Well, the hollow stem should've been it's defining feature. She also kept tell us the tough pieces in our drunken noodle is asparagus. Well, it is not. And you shouldn't add asparagus to drunken noodles. 

All in all, a place with overpriced and subpar food.
author: Xiaofei Y.

description: This review is for happy hour only. I was browsing on Yelp to find new HH places and came across this. The menu wasn't bad so we went to try it. However, we weren't impressed with HH bites. The only decent thing I like was the dumplings ($1 each). The corn Fritos aren't as yummy(I would much rather have fries). Then the chicken skewers had that grill taste that left with a weird after taste. Now let's get to the drinks, they were a bit watered down. Needless to say, good pricing but mediocre HH bites
author: Ann L.

description:
Was here for Happy Hour with my friend and we both orders lots of nibs here. We were on the first four and got one of the high tables.

$1 dumplings butternut squash, red curry sauce 
$1 oysters local variety, kim chee cocktail sauce 
indonesian corn fritter bites 
ahi tuna tartare 
tamarind & hoisin pork spare rib 
CHICKEN SATAY 
MUSHROOM SATAY
salt & pepper calamari (get a side of the kimchee cocktail sauce with it)

Moscow mule 
blushing geisha 
E&old fashioned
MAGGIO Sauvignon Blanc, California '12

I was running late, but i heard that the dumplings and fritter was tasty.

Super big fan of oysters and the ones here were nicely fat and brine. The kimchee cocktail sauce was so good.

Wasn't expecting to like the tartare, but the fish was a good quality.

Pork Spare Rib was good, but not amazing.

The chicken satay was super moist but you only get one stick. (the pickles with it were nicely sour).

The mushroom satay was kinda forgettable, but decent. Maybe if there were grill marks for a less sloggy satay.

Calamari goes well with the old fashion and the blushing geisha (which my friend LOVED).


Total: 56.31 for two people for a Tuesday night
author: Mei L.

description: Loved our New Year's Eve dinner there. The lamb naan, curry shrimp ceviche, shaking beef and Indonesian fried rice were awesome! Service was great too. Will definitely be back!
author: Margarette T.

description:
I came here for dinner with my family and found it to be a rather slightly pricer "P.F. Changs." 

This place has lots of space for large groups and parties! I really enjoyed the modern, Asian inspired feel to the space. My family was placed in rather cozy area with other small parties, so every family/group could hear each others' conversations. 

For our appetizer, we had their salt and pepper calamari, which was not very salty nor very pepper. It was just a plain calamari. We also had the Indonesian fried rice, drunken noodles, and grilled flatiron steak.  The fried rice was so delicious and hearty with mild spice. The steak was intense with kim chi flavor but I found it odd that it was paired with roasted potatoes. The drunken noodle was full of bold spices and with a good heaping portion of veggies, making it more of veggie stir fry.
author: Kristine C.

description:
We got the pork ribs (not bad) the beef topokki (it's an average dish, the Korean rice sticks were too thick for me) the lamb naan (not that great, very less lamb inside, and it's very dry, used to taste better before) and finally the butternut squash dumpling (this I found delicious, the best of all we ordered, in spite of the fact that I'm a hardcore non vegetarian )
We found they changed some of their menu. 
The ambience and service are good!
author: Amrita G.

description: The worst customer service from the start. The hostess never even acknowledges standing in front of her desk. It took her three minutes to get off the phone. Then she put us by the kitchen. Don't waste your time!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Went there for lunch and absolutely loved the restaurant. The dumplings we ordered for appetizers were fresh and well made. I had ordered satay for lunch meal and it was delicious as well. The ambiance is very nice. 

I would recommend this place.
author: Amit H.

description: Best experience for my first time in S.F. Service was great bartender was awesome. Food came out super fast did not take longer then 5mins. Their Pad Thai was the best definitely recommend it to anybody that's visiting S.F. Union square.
author: Ivan H.

description: E&O was a pretty good place for our happy hour meal.  Andy, our bartender/server was awesome!  (Aloha Andy!) The HH oysters were good, but the butternut squash dumplings were awesome!  We highly recommended this establishment for a casual dining experience.
author: Trevor A.

description: Adding a star. Mostly because the happy hour is totally worth it! I'm still not the biggest fan but the happy hour is a-ok.  Service at the bar was acceptable as well. Hurzah!
author: Susan C.

description:
By far one of my favorite restaurants near the office. 

Most recently, I went to E&O for happy hour with about 16 of my co-workers. Such a nice feeling to be greeted by the hosts with big smiles and such accommodation. The ambience is always very calm and relaxed, despite being full with lots of patrons!

We walked in and we were immediately given the seating area next to the front windows. Our area had a great couch, a bench, and they even help fit our group by moving over some of the lounge-ish chairs into our area as well. Sandra introduced herself as our server--and she was attentive, generous, efficient, and made it feel like we would receive our drinks and food in flash. 

We ordered a round of Pu Pu Platters ($22 Each). Definitely worth the price. Included in the platter was two each of the Indonesian Corn Fritter Bites, the Beef Short Rib Sliders, Tamarind and Hoisin Pork Spare Ribs, and Chicken Satay. The corn fritters were great--nice crisp with traces of a tasty oil that it was fried in. The corn bursts in your mouth with great seasoning that melds so well with the batter. The sliders were so juicy and tender! The slider buns look thick but they were so soft that it complimented the juiciness of the pork. The ribs were rich with sharp flavor--salty at first, but making you want to have another big bite. The Satay, I felt, was pretty average. 

To drink, I had the E&Old Fashioned ($6). Wow. Strong. The orange zest was definitely sharp and gave it that zing that I appreciate in an old fashioned. 

Overall, E&O is definitely on the top of my list for happy hour drinks and bites. Bring your friends! You'll have a great time.
author: Ben C.

description:
Let me start by saying: The food is good! I went for happy hour and they had plenty of yummy options for unreal prices. We all ordered cocktails (so good), with the pu pu platter (amazing), their dumplings (order as many as you can stomach), and steak skewers (they just melt like you would not believe). For four people it was about $150, which was pretty great considering all that we consumed. 

My issue lies with the service. Upon entering (at 3pm) we were given attitude about our lack of reservation, and with the host's hand sweeping across the various empty tables as if to prove a point, informs us that they have many incoming reservations and could not be seated. Thankfully a few minutes later he manages to find us a table. Overall the waiters were ok, but we got the general vibe we should feel #blessed to be sitting where we were. The food is good, and the scene is nice, but one thing I can't stand is this kind of pretentiousness. I would go back for the happy hour and food, but was not impressed with the service.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Had an enjoyable meal here late on a Saturday evening.

We ordered the devilled eggs, coconut ceviche, chicken satay, and duck roll.

All dishes were good. The coconut ceviche came in a carved out coconut which was pretty cool. I particularly enjoyed the devilled eggs, and the chicken satay was nice and tender. 

The ambience is really nice here, with high ceilings and a fancy bar area. One downside was that the upstairs was occupied by a bachelorette party who were loud enough to be heard downstairs (!)

Considering the high prices nothing about this place really wowed me, hence 3 stars.
author: Steph A.

description:
So, came here a couple of years back and because of the corn fritters I always told myself I would revisit someday. Finally came back with the bf for happy hour, he liked the fritters also but this time around we told ourselves we'll be back for the oysters. Atmosphere is very calming, nice and dim with great seating in the bar area. Servers and bussers are friendly and attentive and drinks are great. Happy hour has a great variety of food items and nice refreshing cocktails, but most of all the oysters are best. We order the fritters of course, oysters w/a kim chee cocktail sauce, along with the pu pu platter w/2 more fritters, 2 sliders, 2 ribs, 2 chicken satay, 2 ahi tuna tartare, taro chips, and pickled veggies. I believe it was progression of how the dishes came out that caused us to end up regretting the order of the pu pu platter, but everything else was great. 

First we got the fritters which were great with the tamarind sauce, it was nice and crisp w/out the grease

Next came out the oysters which we loved. The sauce is what really made the dish and kept us on our toes for what was coming next

Lastly came the pu pu platter, had the great fritters again but compared to the first two  dishes this was a bust. Didn't pack as much flavor as the fritters, let alone the oysters, so left us wishing we would have just order 4 dozen more oysters. 

Although our meal didn't have the best ending, we will definitely come back for the fritters and oysters alone.
author: Candice B.

description:
A decent restaurant. The food is good enough, but the decor is more memorable. This a good place to hold a large dinner party/gathering since the menu has a good variety and the restaurant has a lot of space.    It also has going for it that it's one of the more affordable restaurants in the area. Also, the service is pretty good. 

Warning: If you want really authentic Asian cuisine this probably isn't the place for you.
author: Abena O.

description:
The menu looked interesting so I came here with some friends.  We all ordered different appetizers, and they were all tasty.  The Corn Fritters were crunchy, but a bit dry and bland without the sauce.  Papaya salad was huge, although a bit disappointing since I was expecting a spicy kick I have come to associate with papaya salads.
For the main entree I ordered the Malaysian Dry Braised Chicken.  The chicken was tender but the coconut cinnamon sauce was bland but with a strong aftertaste that I couldn't quite pinpoint.  The pineapple salad on the side was super sour.
For dessert, the Mango Panna Cotta was the perfect ending dish.  Nice, fluffy, and not overly sweet.
The atmosphere is trendy, with friendly service.  Food is OK here, but not sure it'll be something I'll be excited for again.
author: Karen L.

description:
What is with the hype? 
This food was GROSS...
Crispy chicken egg rolls were plain and the texture was chewy.
Ordered chicken satay, $28 for 3 chicken skewers that literally tasted like plain grilled chicken and this was sadly the best part of the meal. And an extra $4 for steamed rice.
Lettuce wraps that were so fishy and soft that I literally had to have it sent back to get something else. Got the sliders to replace it and they were soggy and sour BBQ or something.
Seriously paid $75 to go home hungry!
author: E G.

description: The food and service was excellent. We had a late lunch and ordered family style. The chicken spring rolls and mushroom dumplings were heavenly. Highly recommend. The spicy pork sandwich also a treat. I will definitely go back when I am in SF again. Happy hour started 30 minutes after we sat down but we were so hungry we could not wait and we were more than happy when we were finished!
author: Heather S.

description:
I've been there a few times in the past and recently went there for lunch.  The lunch special is a bit expensive at ~$23 or so, but both dishes (chose a butternut squash dumplings and padthai) were pretty good and the padthai dish was huge.

Service was pretty good as well.  I'd be back.
author: Buddha B.

description: I just cannot say enough great things about this restaurant!  I love the atmosphere and of course the food is amazing!  Consistently amazing!  I had the black cod again and it is always phenomenal. The happy hour bites are all delicious and super tasty.  Oysters are on ice, cool and crisp to taste, love the kim chee sauce that accompanies the oysters. The service is amazing, always.  Great place to enjoy great, flavorful food with friends.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Had heard good things about this place and had the opportunity to attend a holiday party here. The food was lavish! I have been back several times and have never been disappointed. Don't miss the black cod. A bit pricey, but out of this world. Also came here for $1 oysters and they were top notch! Service and ambiance are great as well. This is a go to place!
author: T F.

description:
I've heard a lot about E&O... so, when we walked right by this place, it was a no brainer to finally try it. 
The place didn't disappoint - they service was very attentive, they check on all the allergies for us.  I also appreciate when the waiter is knowledgeable about the menu and is comfortable providing recommendations. We ordered pretty much all recommended dishes: green papaya and cucumber salad, Indonesian corm fritters, butternut squash dumplings and grilled steelhead. This was just the right amount for two to share.  
We usually ask for dressing and sauces on the side to well, you know, make it healthier.  But these were so flavorful that I think I ended up using almost every drop.  Especially the curry sauce for butternut squash dumplings. I think I was ready to lick the bowl ;)
One negative was the "speed" - i felt that they were bringing out the food way too fast, I felt a little rushed.  The restaurant was only half full, so I really don't see a point in rushing customers. I also understand complains about the potion size - it's more of a "small plate" place, so I would suggest about 2-3 dishes per person.  

I definitely want to come back and try more.  Pad Thai was also highly recommend and a few other options sounded very tempting.
author: Marianna K.

description:
I've only been for happy hour, but this is hands down my favorite happy hour in SF (especially since it was only a few blocks from my office!). Plus how often do you find a Saturday happy hour?! It does get busy on weekdays so catching your server can take a while (it can be nearly impossible right before 6 p.m. on a Friday), but there's surprisingly few people on Saturdays.

I had a better experience at the bar versus sitting down at a table because you get better service. I love the bartenders, who go out of their way to make you a yummy drink, and they're super nice and personable. The blushing geisha is also absolutely delicious if you're into more tart or sour drinks (and you can't go wrong with tequila!).

My favorite happy hour dish is the squash dumplings--the curry sauce is delicious and the $1/dumpling price during happy hour seals the deal. I've also had the oysters (also just $1 each!), the tuna tartare, and the chicken skewers, and everything tasted fantastic, but I always go back to my dumplings.

I've recommended this place to so many people, and everyone has fallen in love. On top of the great food, I love that it's a very casual place with a classy and intimate atmosphere.

Every time I visit SF in the future, I already know I'll be putting aside a couple of hours to stop by for a drink and a plate full of dumplings.
author: Queenie T.

description: The hostess is obnoxiously rude and totally ruins your mood. Came here at 4:30pm for happy hour and place is already PACKED with people from Dreamforce (ugh!!!). Apparently you can only sit down at a real table if you have a reservation even though they're empty, so the bar ends up being super packed... Makes no sense eh? Drinks and food are pretty cheap though. Hostess seriously need an attitude check
author: Emily L.

description: Great happy hour. $4 draft, $6 cocktails.  The $1 oysters were fresh and clean, without any grit. Also for a dollar, you can get the butternut squash dumplings. They were so yum!  What a bargain.  The tamarind & hoisin spare ribs were good, comparable to almost any Asian restaurant.  I really liked the wood roasted char siu black cod.  The fish was so delicate and flaky, the sauce didn't overpower the fish , and was cooked to perfection.  My favorite dish had to be the Indonesian corn fritters.  I don't think I've had anything like them before. They were deep fried, with a lovely chili soy dipping sauce.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Funk G.

description: Worst dining experience, enough to make me come on Yelp after near 7 years.  Waitress chased us out of the restaurant and bullied us for larger tip.  Was dining with my Irish boyfriend and best friend also from Ireland, when we paid the bill, she followed us and said "In America, we tip for service" when we told her the service was mediocre and wee had left deserved tip,  she persisted to say she had done above and beyond and demanded that we tip her more; pointing out that she didn't make money after taxes.  A. I'm American and know tipping etiquette  and after traveling for the past three years have come to the value the tip as something as deserved and not mandatory.  B. In California employees make not only minimum wage, but for waitresses, tips as well.  If she can not afford to live in San Francisco, perhaps she should consider moving to somewhere more affordable.  Food was decent, but the service and Rude and uncalled for, the attitude of the waitress was the only rude American experience and certainly left a sour taste in our mouths.
author: melissa n.

description: Do not go for the $1 happy hour oysters!! My friend and I we appalled upon receiving the dozen we ordered. If we did not know any better we'd have thought they'd actually cut the oysters in 1/2 or thirds and then served them to us!! They had none of the natural liquor and were the size of a dime, sitting in huge shells....had I been their chef I would never have let something of that caliber leave my kitchen. Had I been our waitress I would have never been able to serve anything that looked like that to my tables! Shame on them!
author: Lauren E.

description:
OMG.. Went there for the third time for Xmas eve lunch.  Horrible, horrible, just plain horrible.  The rib appetizer was chewy, not the best way to start a lunch.  The Beef/Chicken Satay was terrible.  The beef truly tasted old!  Old!  Did not eat.  The stir fry, was just terrible. The vodka rocks.. well how do you mess that up.. tiny, tiny glass...  So for $90.00 for lunch, will not be back.  I would suggest to anyone that you avoid.  Both of our stomachs were upset after.. well.. thats the only meal we had.. so guess where that came from..

Avoid
author: Sue P.

description: I brought my family here after my friend and I found this fun hangout with great food. Unfortunately the service was less than par! My husband sat with his diet Coke empty about 95% of the time, we asked for the dessert menu she never came back to ask us if we'd like dessert, I had to ask continuously for water, the dirty plates were left on the table until the very end of the evening. The server never came to check on us, we had to flag her down each time, and I am not a flagger! Very very disappointing! We watched her literally standing around talking to her colleagues most of the evening! We even notice the table next to us was very very low on water sitting there waiting with no food on the table! And they were not over busy at all! Sucks.... because I actually like the food!!!
author: Kristin I.

description:
Appetizers are amazing.  We had both the papaya salad and the lamb naan. so delicious although a bit spicy.  We found the heat level to be perfect for us but if you are sensitive to chillies then you may want to ask for it a bit milder.

Had the special Malaysian chicken curry for the main dish, which we found to lacking in taste.  Bland and the chicken was not juicy.  We mentioned it to the waitress only because she was so incredibly friendly and helpful while we were choosing our meal.  She expressed her surprise as she had tasted the same dish earlier in the night and said it was great.  She was spot on with her appetizer recs so perhaps it was a fluke with our curry.  In any case she recommended the special dessert of a chocolate pyramid (not on the menu) and after she brought it out and we devoured it, she then told us it was on the house.  

We will definitely be going back and if you haven't tried it, please do.
author: Malabika M.

description:
Pros: Tasty drinks, interesting menu, tasty appetizers. 
Cons: slow service, entrees were a bit bland and slightly overpriced. 
On the whole, just ok.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Great interior design and tasty creative dishes. Got the Shrimp salad - the dressing was very light and there were lots of fruits ! It was more like a fruit salad with shrimp.

Down fall- the shrimp on my salad was peeled; however the thorny tail of the shrimp was left on one of my shrimp and the skin was left on another shrimp. The thorny tail was really painful - especially because I discovered it upon it stabbing my gums. 

Overall, it was a great lunch spot. It was quiet enough to be appropriate for a lunch meeting.
author: Rumiko K.

description:
Cute little happy hour spot I visited with some old coworkers one weeknight.

They have a happy hour that ends at 6 or 630pm nightly I think. 

I got here around 5ish and snagged a table for my friends and I and started to order happy hour appetizers.

We ordered the pupu platter, a round of the butternut squash dumplings and 2 dozen oysters. 

Everything was great as far as bar bites go. Although the pricing seems pretty cheap, be careful as everything does add up pretty quickly. The small bites are literally just that, small one bite for each person. Even the oysters were super tiny!

We were all just a tad hungry so ended up ordering a couple of entrees afterwards which filled us up!

All in all its a great atmosphere to catch up with friends. If you are not too hungry the small bites are great. If you are hungrier I'd share a couple of entrees instead!
author: Christine W.

description:
Great experience! Went for lunch around 1 pm on Saturday and LOVED the food! It was prepared very well and well seasoned and fresh, super impressed! We got the BBQ buns (spicy delicious - not fatty) and the mushroom dumplings ( these were ok) and the corn fritters (amazing sweet crunchy salty with spicy sauce.. Delicious! ) the ribs were great and the Indonesian fried rice was better than any fried rice I had in over 2 weeks in Bali. 

This is a great spot the service and food are above the San Francisco standard! Impressive for a restaurant near union square! Highly recommend for lunch or dinner , drinks are GREAT too!
author: L V.

description: Best restaurant by far in Union Square area  service is great and food is delicious!!!! Great happy hour and super super yummy food our server Ranesha was really nice and super friendly! Can't wait to go back!!!
author: amy h.

description: I just arrived to San Francisco with my girl friend after driving from San Diego. We were hungry and wanted to get something good to food and a drink to begin our vacation. We started with the Pu Pu Platter which was delicious. It's basically a sampler platter of some of their happy hour items. Next we got the dumplings, the wood oven naan and the steak satay, which were all perfectly cooked and mouth watering delicious. We drank out conquest of the happy hour menu with some of their happy hour Moscow Mules. My boy Zack was the bartender and made the drinks like a true professional! Will come again!
author: Gregorio V.

description: Stopped by for a dinner with 7 friends! For the price that we paid, the food quality and flavors could have been much much better! I did appreciate that they were really great with the toddler at our table - so kudos to the staff and kitchen! Brought her some non spicy noodles and chicken and milk to drink as we asked for it.
author: Shubhra S.

description:
Trendy is the word. 
Good service. 
Interesting fusion food selection. 
Family style makes dining fun and happy!

No major issue, I actually enjoyed the experience a lot. 
But probably coz it's new, it might take them a while to rise another half notch to be great and impress people!
author: Wendy G.

description:
I don't understand why this place doesnt have a better rating. Location is great (unless you're driving), but if you're shopping in Union Square... perfect. The HH is really awesome  for the price, and i have to highlight the squash dumplings/blushing geisha/and HH wine. So good. 

For the meal we just got a mix of appetizers, HH stuff, and sides. My favorites were the eggplant and sauteed spinach. With brown rice, perfect vegetarian meal. 

The host, a male with really nice earrings (I was admiring them), was great and polite. Our server TIM was awesome, fun, and knew his stuff. 

I will be back!
author: Kim D.

description:
Like Elephant Bar but higher class people, decor and prices. Food is pretty good, too.
Inventive cocktails, too, which is a must nowadays in San Francisco. 

If you are driving, just park at the Sutter Stockton Garage up the street.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
This is one of those high end places in downtown where you can expect food to be delicious and high quality, but also a little bit small and pricy. The atmosphere is classy and most people are fairly dressed up, though they aren't snobby about it. It's a fairly big space, able to accommodate a wide variety of party sizes.

But enough about the place, let's talk about the food. My friends and I came by after work on a weekday and ordered food to share. Here's what I thought of everything:
- Indonesian Corn Fritters: These were pretty tasty and came sprinkled with some light spices. Deep-fried on the outside and kind of chewy on the inside, I actually thought the texture took a little bit of getting used to, but once I did, I enjoyed the fritters a lot. Definitely something you want to share because I'm not entirely sure I'd want to eat a whole one of these by myself. (There are 2 of these.)
- Beef and Short Rib Sliders: Tender, marinated beef sliders. They come with thinly-sliced taro chips which are very delicious (not your average potato chips!) but kind of hard to pick up. (There's 3 of them and they're really cute! Unfortunately, that also means they're kind of tiny... )
- Butternut Squash Dumplings: These were very good - soft and chewy with sweet butternut squash filling. The curry was flavorful but not overwhelming and paired surprisingly well with the dumplings. (There are 5 of these.)
- Japanese "Bop": The sunny-side up egg pairs with the pickled vegetables nicely, and is served on top of something that kind of resembles a fried rice cake. I know that doesn't sound very appetizing, but it's really, really great.

Asian Fusion is all about combining unexpected flavors, and E&O does a good job of this. Ingredients seem fresh, high-quality, and well thought out. Service is fine but not fantastic, but I do appreciate that they let us hang around for a bit longer after dinner without trying to kick us out. Good place to go with your "classy" friends to grab drinks and small plates to share after work.
author: Brittany C.

description: Pretty solid Asian fusion spot. If you're not sure, they are leaning more toward the Thai side. As for the place, the decor is nice. Food is pretty solid, but a bit pricey. Lastly, service was also good. I would mostly recommend this place if you're going on a date. Thankfully, they have a parking garage next door.
author: Sonlay V.

description: A great find on the same block as the convenient Sutter-Stockton garage. We came for happy hour and treats before a nearby lecture. Food and drinks were tasty and service attentive. Pleasant postmodern atmosphere with Asian-inspired cuisine.
author: Dani L.

description:
Great happy hour menu.. There is something for everyone. They also have a cool happy hour drink menu with lots of choices between beer, wine and mixed drinks. However, beware because after 6:00 everything on the happy hour menu doubles in price. Some places, the prices go up a few bucks but here everything doubles. 
We had oysters which were actually very good and generous in size. The pu pu platter had something for everyone buts it's really only enough for two people. Needless to say, I will be back here. Service was great and the food was pretty delicious.
author: Jannet H.

description: I've only been here twice and both times were for happy hour. The happy hour cocktails are delicious. Food is pretty good, although their oysters are super tiny... but they're only $1. Their sliders and tuna tartare are tasty as well! Staff is also very friendly and attentive. Definitely one of my favorite happy hour sports.
author: Lina C.

description: Nestled closed to the fi di district, this place has an upscale Asian fusion ambiance that is welcoming at first sight. Stop by for happy hour and you can enjoy some dollar oysters and well made old fashioned's. Attentive staff make you feel well served and the food will make you stay awhile. The mushroom satay is highly recommended if you like a nice smoky flavor to accompany that old fashioned; E and O is definitely a good choice for any foodie or anyone looking for a pleasant evening.
author: Brandon E.

description:
Bottom line: Overpriced and pretty good food. 
Not excellent. I want to give 3.5 stars but I will choose 4 because the greeter was super friendly and accommodating, the ambience was great and the food was esthetically pleasing. 

Butternut squash dumplings - very good, yummy curry sauce. A little on the spicy side, but good flavors. You only get 4 or 5 small dumplings for $13 and that seemed pretty pricey to me. 

Pork tenderloin - very tender, tasty, extremely spicy. The chilies on this burnt my mouth for about 3 minutes. If you Love spicy, this is for you. The green beans served with it were really yummy. 

Malaysian braised chicken - I asked the waitress if it was spicy, she said not at all. Yes it was. It's pretty spicy. Maybe like a 5 on a scale of 1-10 and my tolerance is about a 3 max. The salad served with it was okay.
author: Sheryl T.

description: Love this place! Came here with coworkers a few nights ago to give a beloved coworker her grand sendoff, and we all had a blast. We had a private room to ourselves in the back, the service was excellent, drinks were great, and the appetizers were fantastic. If you get anything here, try their corn fritters...they are divine! In short it was a great experience and I can't wait to go back.
author: Sara W.

description:
Enjoyed happy hour bites last minute, as my son and I walked in around 3 p.m.  Restaurants nearby had nothing for kids, appeasing his taste bud is quite difficult at times.  I figured you can't go wrong with Asian Fusion, he can have his rice and sliders, too :-)  Our server Sergio was so timely and patient with our orders, which was pretty much everything off their HH menu.  My son enjoyed the tasty sliders and ribs.  I enjoyed the ahi popper, bread, fritter bites, and dumplings.  Everything was so flavorful, we had to order something off their regular menu, which was the fried rice - delicious!  Due to E&O hosting an epic YELP party for Elites, they'll always be remembered for their unique dining experience in the heart of SF!  We will continue coming back to our favorite hot spot.  I tend to rate restaurants by how their restrooms look, E&O has immaculate restrooms.  Gotta love the sign in the women's stall courteously advising ladies to have mercy on their plumbing and not to flush anything except toilet paper, witty!

P.S.  I sure miss the Larkspur location, good times!
author: Christine R.

description: Came here for a group dinner with about 50 people from my company. They have a private room downstairs which was great for the group. The staff was friendly and attentive. There is a bar in the room as well. The food was pretty standard, nothing really stood out, basic asian fusion. The sauces were so-so, but some of the deep fried foods were good.
author: Jonah K.

description: Service was great and everyone was very courteous and friendly but apart from the convenience of the location, this is not worth  going back for.  Ordered the chicken lettuce cups and it was a messy sauce-y blob of chicken water chestnuts and pine nuts where you couldn't distinguish any ingredients., Nothing like the ones at PF Chang's.   Also ordered the eggplant and tofu side and again it was just an overly sauced blob.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Don't confuse E&O for a mixed-bag, master of none kitchen operation.
Each cuisine was carried out with individual excellence - Indonesian, Chinese, Thai - I would have believed that the items all came from separate kitchens had I not been seated beside the very chefs doing the work in one great open space at the rear of the restaurant. 

Highlights were the Malaysian Chicken, with green curry and coconut atop a pineapple and jicama salad; as well as the Indonesian Fried Rice, which was spicy with white prawns and umami pop.
author: Justin W.

description: First time here. We didn't have a reservation and we were Seated fast. The food was great and the employees and super nice and fast. Definitely coming here again.
author: Queen H.

description:
I ate Grilled Chicken Bahn Mi here. It was good..just good...I thought It needed more flavor in it...and also Mango pannacotta wasn't to my taste..but I liked the homemade chips and lemonade! 
In addition, All staff & service were very nice :)
author: Sachi S.

description: More of 3.5 stars but I'm feeling generous today so rounding up to 4. Food is decent, ambience is nice. Service was a little slow. Overall I'd come back.
author: Tinou B.

description:
Came to E&O tonight for a networking event (so this review is about their event space/planning and not about their sit-down dining).

I have to admit, I was impressed. This a BIG restaurant - with bar seating, downstairs dining room, as well as a South and North mezzanine for private events. Our networking mixer took place in the North Mezzanine. It was a nice secluded spot, far enough away from all the loud bar/dining room noises. The happy hour mixer we attended included our own private bar/bartender (they were serving beer/wine/Prosecco). But what surprised me the most was the high quality of the passed appetizers. At most of these networking events, you're lucky if the restaurant has a cheese/charcuterie plate and a few olives to nibble on. Not the case at E&O! Au contraire, mon frere! Guests were treated to a generous variety of signature bites, including: the deep fried corn fritters + dipping sauce, chicken + beef satay, mini-risotto balls, and some other tasty Asian-inspired apps. Everything was delicious. I can't imagine that anyone left this party with an empty stomach. Service was also top-notch (everyone from the bartender to the wait-staff). These guys really nailed it!

If you're looking for a good, centrally located restaurant near Union Square to host a private affair (whether it be work or personal), E&O is a fantastic option. 

Bonus: there's convenient parking a few doors down at the Sutter/Stockton Garage!
author: Kevin B.

description:
E&O's is mentioned in the San Francisco 7x7, which is kind of cool I can cross that off my list. Their atmosphere felt very cozy, it was very spread out and there were sitting upstairs as well as bigger party space downstairs. I will only be review their lunch menu, so there can be different opinions based off their dinner menu. 

I had their ginger ale, which tasted very gingery to me, which I liked. I wasn't sure how much ginger there was, since I was coming off the novocaine. I ordered Pad Thai, which had white shrimp, tofu, radish, egg, bean sprouts, peanuts, roasted chilies, and lime. I have to say that I wasn't a huge fan, I like my Pad Thai to have a sauce on the noodles, and their noodles had a sticky kind of texture. As well as the lack of sauce, there was just too much filler, and it over powered my taste buds, where it just made my mouth feel like it was on fire by all the spice and peppers, that I wasn't able to taste whether or not the shrimp were fresh or if the tofu was too spongey. 

Prices: I wouldn't spend as much as my mom did for lunch for 2 people. It was kind of ridiculous. 

Check out my profile to find my official blogs as well as more food reviews
author: Food G.

description: Well priced, smart chic decor, obliging service. A hard combination to find in downtown. My personal favorites are the butternut squash dumplings in red curry and the paneer parata. The usher and waiters are very kid friendly which is a huge bonus. Highly recommended.
author: Priya K.

description:
The place design beautifu!l the service is ok..
but the food is not so good..and expensive definitely not it!!
We were four people we all ordered pad Thai and we ask for peanuts on the side they charge us 4$!! I'm going many times to Thai restaurant and I've never had to pay on this.
I won't be back.
author: Maya F.

description: Yum! Food was excellent! Great apps! We tried the burger made with mushrooms and it was very good.  Fries were excellent. Apps were the best!
author: neon m.

description: We ate here yesterday and were really happy that we chose this restaurant. We arrived late, about half an hour before the kitchen was closing but the personnel were really welcoming despite our late arrival. The food was great! We ate chicken and shrimp sauté with rice and roasted asparagus, which all was awesome. We also had a CA Pinot noir which was excellent.
author: Josephine B.

description: I went for my belated bday party with a couple friends. We absolutely loved the food! We ordered the chickpea fries, potatoes (for our vegetarian friend), Indonesian fried rice and Chicken Satay. The food arrived at a timely manner and we had a really nice server!
author: Trinh N.

description:
The venue is really nice; great modern décor, great layout, spacious, intimate lighting, and best of all, super great service.

Upon walking in, there is an area immediately to your left with couches and tables, next to it is the front desk where the gentleman was very polite and kind.  He walked us to our table which was occupied by a couple of our parties (the guys were at the bar watching the big playoff game).   You can see the entire kitchen along the back wall; it is open space and kind of fun to watch.  

On to the food:

Appetizer - Indonesian Corn Fritters:  3/5.  Yes, I read the reviews and just about everyone suggested these corn fritters.  They were interesting but however, it did not have the "wow" factor. I thought this was a bit bland.  What's all the hype about? 
 
Appetizer - Tea Deviled Eggs: 3/5.  Um....$2.25 for half an egg?  I can get a whole carton of those at Costco for that price!  Worth trying once, but not again.  The presentation was there, unfortunately the taste wasn't. 
 
Main dish - Beef short rib sliders: 3/5. Taro chips were so addicting!  The beef was tender and juicy, but the pickled veggies ruined the flavor.  It tastes like expensive westernized banh mi.  

Main dish - Beef Toppoki: 3/5.  My friend ordered this dish and I took a few bites.  The rice cake is smaller than the traditional size so it's more bite-sized.  It was cooked well so not too soggy nor hard from overcooking.  The beef was also very tender and flavorful.  However if you are Korean and used to the spicy toppoki, then this might be a little funny to you since you wont get the fish cake or the spice.

Main dish - Koda Farms Heirloom Rice Stir-Fry: 2/5.  Couldn't take more than two bites of this.  My friend who ordered did not like it at all.  For me it was bearable, but I would never get this again.  Had a funny taste to it.  

If you want rice, you have to order that as a side.....really?? You can't just include your dishes with rice?  Um, no thank you.  This place is overpriced for what you get.  The food is average.  They have a good selection of wine.

The only good thing about this restaurant is the service and ambiance.  I may or may not be back.....but most likely not.
author: Erica C.

description: Food was very flavorful!  Atmosphere was trendy and upscale, but very comfortable.  We ordered the oysters, Pad Thai, and Shaken Beef.  Very spicy but not overwhelming.  Perfectly cooked.  Panna cotta was amazing!!!   Miguel was our server.  Service was very friendly and gave good insight on the menu.  Recommended!
author: John D.

description:
Dinner here last night was amazing. I'd been once before, maybe 10 years ago, and was  little worried because the ratings seemed to have gone down. Also, it was easy to get in on Saturday night with only an hour advance notice (OpenTable), after all the other places we'd picked first turned out to be fully booked.

But WOW.

Everything here was amazing. Our waitress (wish I knew her name) was spectacular, even working extra hard to accommodate a food sensitivity. My butternut squash dumplings appetizer were amazing -- would have eaten a whole bowl of them for dinner. Others at the table shared oysters. There was some discussion about what kind they were, evidently not what was normally available, but my oyster-loving friends said they were perhaps the best they'd ever tasted anywhere. For entrees, we split the dry rubbed chicken and the black cod. Both were beyond awesome. For dessert, we all shared a tiny little mango panna cotta, and I wish I'd had one the size of a watermelon. Just amazing!
author: George Y.

description: Came here for dinner and throughly enjoyed the experience. The vibe was Iively and the specialty cocktails are outstanding. I had the shaken beef with jasmin rice and it was cooked perfectly. Great place to go on a date or with a group of friends.
author: Teree H.

description:
the menus were fancy asian much better than expected. enjoyed most of it. too bad, the server didn't know they can make a virgin mojito, he also forgot to serve our drinks. we sat next to the bar, so we could see our drinks were left on the counter. other server didn't bring it even we asked him , and their coffee was terrible. trying to make vietnamese style? the server should be trained to make it right. 
we may try again since their food was good.
author: Jessica P.

description: This place is my comfort food place. I always order inn, and Alfredo at the front desk is great! I always get paneer naan and the corn fritters. The wait time during lunch is typically 20 mins on a busy day.
author: Seerat S.

description:
I have to say this place was absolutely incredible!!!! Came here this past weekend with my boyfriend and another couple for an early anniversary dinner and we all loved it! 
The ambiance was perfect for the night. We came around 5:30 and there weren't many people so we were seated and served quickly.
We came when happy hour was still happening and we ordered a few things from that menu, as well as the regular menu. Everything that we ordered was perfectly cooked and super fresh. The food presentation was great. All the meats were tender and cooked just right. The veggies were perfectly sautéed. All the mini appetizers were to die for. Everything was so yummy and unique. This is definitely something you don't eat everyday. 
I have to say I was really impressed by all the food and the prices were very decent.
I can guarantee that this is now one of my top favorite places near Union Square! I'll be back here very soon :))
author: Julia K.

description:
Don't seat at community table at the front of the restaurant! You will NEVER sea any wait staff. Service was really slow!!
After walking up to the hostess I have to give her a credit that she hunted down the waiter who finally took the order. Probably 2 minutes later the corn fritters came up pipping hot. 
Have not tried that type of deep fried food before. It was interesting but walking out from the restaurant I kept spitting out the unpleasant taste of overused cooking oil. 

All i was thinking - "how often do they change the oil in their friers".  Good space for a larger groups, and for those who are not foodies.
author: Xela H.

description: Atmosphere is very nice here. Food was good but nothing blew me away. The service was amazing though. Tommy took such good care of us that it made our night. He is a true professional and is extremely good at what he does. I'd most certainly come back if we're in the area.
author: James W.

description: The shrimp salad was great and so was a lot of other plates. One dish drunken noodles had burnt veggies which gave it a bitter taste.  A clean place with great service. The only small problem was the no parking validation and the price is just a little higher. Overall it is a great place.
author: J B.

description: We decided to try a new place that had great reviews, but we were not impressed.  First off let me say that I work at a classy Asian Fusion restaurant in Marin County and know the restaurant business very well and we are NOT RUDE nor PUSHY. We had a larger party of 8 adults and sat upstairs.  It would 20 minutes to get water to our table, given we had to ask.  After staring at our server for several minutes and he dodging our eye contact he finally came over to the table.  He said he "missed our table." After ordering drinks and food everything started to come out in random orders.  Our drinks took 15 minutes to arrive (we didn't order cocktails). With the odd order of food coming and lack of service we tried the food.  The food was very good! Unfortunately the service was lacking.  One of our party guests ordered a martini. It came in a weird sherbet glass with about 1.5 oz of alcohol.  Two dished failed to come out, and our plates were cleared and given dessert menus.  The server then asked if we wanted our food... the kitchen and server was disorganized.  We spoke to the manager about the martini just to let him know the glass was odd and that we found it lacking.  He didn't offer anything, but he gave us his card for the next time we come back... like we would go back. Anytime someone is nice about a mistake or something like the food not coming out we always offer them a complimentary dessert and an apology.  We got a defensive manager that said "yelping him" was mean... Your a restaurant and should strive to provide great service, it is the restaurant business after all. Overall the experience was unfortunate, it could have been all fine if we received better service and treatment from the manager.
author: Lilly K.

description:
Came here with the sis and her group of friends for an advanced holiday dinner. 

The place was packed... managed to maneuver gingerly to get to our table... 

Service was actually prompt and friendly considering it was uber busy! It was a nice change!

We ended up sharing / family style our meals and I think we got the following:
-WOOD ROASTED EDAMAME BEANS = it was edamame... tasted like one... no biggie.

- PANIR NAAN = okay tasting... doesn't compare to traditional Indian places...

- GRILLED TAMARIND PORK SPARE RIBS = wasn't a fan... just didn't jive well in the mouth.

- BLACK PEPPER SHAKING BEEF = this was actually quite spicy... I ended up letting the guys eat this... 

- ROASTED BRUSSELS SPROUTS = loved this... simple yet tasty! 

- MANGO PANNA COTTA = LOVED this... I actually managed to finish this on my own! 

We ordered a bunch more but I don't remember them... they weren't that meaningful to remember to begin with. 

Probably not going back again... the food didn't really wow us... been there... done that. Moving on...
author: Cath M.

description: Everything is delicious!  Don't miss the corn fritter and the pork pot stickers.  Calamari and lamb noodle were amazing too!
author: Allie S.

description: Probably the worst meal I've ever eaten. Terrible food. Food had no flavor and  service was mediocre at best. With so many great places to eat, made me sad to spend $100 for a lunch that was so bad.
author: Mary J.

description: We came to try this place out for restaurant week. I made reservation at 7:45 pm. We arrived and got seated on time. At the same time they seated party of 3 on our left. We ordered food, waited. I noticed how party on the left got their food, 10 mins passed, 15, we got our appetizers... ok... then we waited almost 30 mins for main dish. It came in huge portions but really blent on spice, potatoes feel a little bit undercooked. Anyways, we only eat about 30-35% and asked server to box it. He had attitude when we asked that. Then we got the dessert. We left restaurant at 9:20. For SF i consider it inefficient timing. When we sat, we ordered the food and drinks in 7-8 mins, no more than 10. It takes an hour for all courses come. Consider we didnt take really long time with main dish at all, we spent 50 minutes just waiting waiting, 25 minutes eating, 10 minutes ordering, and 10 minutes paying and leaving... thats is really long wait time, dont suggest coming for lunch at all, you will be late for work. The wait time need to be cut by 30 minutes to be efficient restaurant in such a big city. And that was Wednesday night... the worth part is i got food poisoning when i got home. All night. And obviously i through away the left over right away, i dont need another night of sleepless night after a 3 course dining. And i do know what caused that. Lamb curry. Even i had less than 35% of the food...
author: Nataly S.

description: I had my graduation party here last week with a group of 18 people. The food was fresh and  sensational. Everything was timed perfectly, beginning with the appetizers coming out 10 minutes after we arrived. The service was very attentive and efficient. They kept our water glasses and beverages filled at all times. Akop and Alfredo were both fabulous and made us feel very well taken care of.
author: Emily L.

description:
A little shabby inside for pricing; the food, however, is really delicious. I got the burger and a number of smaller tapas. Everything tasted beautifully rich.

I recommend this restaurant often to friends and guests in the city. The staff are incredibly nice and accommodating. The cost of the Moscow Mules is sky-high, but to be expected in Union Square, and they're worth the weight in gold--delicious! The burger was perfectly priced. The tapas were right-sized in terms of ego and price. All drink options are special...not run of the mill at E&O.

The restaurant has a serene ambiance; it's a pleasure compared to the crowded noisiness of the shopping area surrounding.
author: Philip C.

description:
I was in San Fran for a work trip and some co-worker suggested this place. I am not a fan of "fusion" food so I didn't expect much...and I was surprised at how good it was! So surprised I ate here 3 times in one week :) This is what you need to eat:

1. the devilled eggs - weird I know but trust me!
2. The corn fritters are to die for.
3.Drunken Noodles - I crave these weekly and I am so sad I can't get them flown in!
4. The Pad Thai is pretty good ...
4. Nice wine selection!
5 You can order to take out and have a drink in the lounge while you wait!

I have taken a few co-works back and it's becoming know as the place the Canadian's eat while we are in our San Fran office for meetings!

Anyway - love this place, good food, service and  nice atmosphere. It gets pretty busy so reservations are recommended!
author: Kreag S.

description: This restaurant has a different menu at lunch and dinner time. Came here today for a quick appetizer and was not disappointed. They have every day drink specials. I tried the prickle pear soda which was very different but tasty. People who work close by get a discont, Whoohoo! lol the service is great.
author: Carina P.

description:
(+)
- beef toppoki 18
- bananamisu dessert
- devils food cake dessert

(-)
- matcha green tea dessert

Cute little place near Union Square. Had a work dinner here, kind of dim lighting inside. Prices typical of this area if not lower.

I ordered the beef toppoki cause I love korean rice sticks. Beef and rice sticks were flavorful and cooked nicely. Delicious dish but I prefer the redder more saucy version. 

For dessert we split 3 between 6 of us. Each one was 9 bucks.

The bananamisu was amazing. The devils food cake was so good and moist, and the salted caramel that came with it was a great combo. Highly recommend both of these. 

Pass on the matcha green tea, its like a shot of green tea with ice cream? only good part was the green tea kit kat. Its difficult to share a shot of green tea plus it wasn't very dessert-like at all.

Overall an affordable place for dinner with some solid desserts that's walking distance from union square
author: Julia S.

description:
Wow, I really had an incredible meal at E&O - fantastic!

I hadn't had a meal since the reopening of this restaurant so I was really excited about experiencing the new space as well as the new menu.  

To start, the food was incredible.  I had the Wood Grilled Burger, which did not disappoint.  The beef was of great quality and seasoned perfectly...it went very well with the pickled onions, kimchee and sriracha aioli...I requested white cheddar cheese which added another layer of richness to the burger.  All the savory flavors were perfectly matched by the scallion bun, which had great texture and subtle flavors to compliment the interior of the burger.  The togorashi fries were also very good and almost cleaned the palate with the quality flavor from the potatoes and slight kick from the spices.

Besides the burger, I also had an off-menu item: "Secret Fries".  These special fries, which haven't yet been made quite so public, were incredible - probably the most inventive fries I've come across: a bed of perfect potato fries topped with kimchee, sriracha aioli and cheddar cheese - wow!  This was almost a meal on its own since it was hearty and full-flavored...similar flavors to the burger, without the meat (although, I'm sure you can request these with bacon or short ribs if you wanted them).  This would make for the perfect starter item at a table or something to munch on while you enjoy cocktails.

I enjoyed E&O before, but I love it now.  All the changes they made were great.  The interior of this restaurant has been updated to a sleek and modern look, but is still comfortable and inviting.  There seems to be more space and one feels less cramped in there compared to the previous set-up.  The staff was friendly and attentive and I always felt like I was taken care of.

For anyone who enjoyed the previous space and restaurant, you will love the new look and menu at E&O.  They really took the best ingredients from all over Asia and created a unique and flavorful menu that anyone can enjoy.  Their famous corn fritters and short rib sliders are still on the menu so even with the new, you can still enjoy your old favorites.
author: Ken G.

description: Killer happy hour. You can't really go wrong with $1 oysters on the half shell. Didn't get into the dinner menu, so cannot comment on that.
author: Randell J.

description:
This place was decent. That's about it, unfortunately. My friend ordered a mojito. It was pretty much just juice and mint. My calamari was way overcooked, spring rolls were burnt, and service was lackluster, though we were sitting right at the bar. 

Cool place otherwise. Ambiance and trendy interior.
author: Emma D.

description:
Food was good. A bit pricey, but unique, not like a typical Asian restaurant menu. We all enjoyed our dishes. 

The one thing I will say is that there didn't seem to be many vegetarian based options, unless you wanted all the carb based dishes like noodles or rice or just a side, but no main dishes. I would have liked to see more veggie based main dishes.
author: angie g.

description: Great food and ambience. The curry ceviche and butternut squash dumplings are worth a shot.
author: John C.

description:
Went on a Wednesday for lunch and there were many open seats so we didn't have to wait at all.

The appetizers were fantastic. We got calamari, butternut squash dumplings, and pork buns. 5 stars for all of these items - the calamari was not too fried or oily like it gets and the dipping sauce it came with was delicious, with a hint of apple. The butternut squash dumplings and pork buns were both fantastic as well.

I got the pad thai as an entree. For a pretty standard thai dish, I definitely tasted better. The dish was strongly scented, which could be off-putting for some. Overall, the taste was mediocre. I was disappointed especially after the great appetizers. If I came back, I would definitely choose a different entree.
author: Maggie Y.

description: Beautiful restaurant, very nice ambiance, and flavorful food. I also loved that along with the bill, they include an offer to give $1 donation to the SF food bank in exchange for feedback about the restaurant.
author: Molly N.

description: Wonderful Asian Fusion type menu. Started with tuna tar tare and it just kept getting better!  The fritters were amazing.  Tommy very efficient waiter. Would highly recommend this place!
author: Dean E.

description:
I am disappointed to report that I had food poisoning from dining at E&O two days ago.  I ordered vegetarian drunken noodles.

We like E&O for its ambience, service and food options generally.  But didn't expect to get food poisoning.  

Hope there is a hygiene check.  I saw another review from a day ago stating food poisoning as well.
author: Vik S.

description:
The food is okay. Nothing stands out.  The waiter is super nice, a five stars for him. The atmosphere is too dark and too loud. This is not a place for family gathering. We were seated at 8pm and some of the items on the menu were out. Corn Fritters is okay although lots of people find it super tasty. The only thing I like is the dumpling.
Way too loud and dark.  I like to at least see what I am eating. I will not come back again.
author: amber T.

description:
Sweet appetizers here at yelp elite event. Chicken satay, beef sliders, spicy fries, and the food network corn. I will return. Great space.

The DJ was rocking, drinks flowing, met some people, no +1, a whole lot of fun.

I donated to the dog effort, rocked my nametag, had the yelp cocktail, champagne, cider, dark and light beer, friendly waiters for sure.
author: Marty J.

description: Good food. Pad Thai was yummy!! Poor service. Ignored the whole time and had to wait too long for the bill.
author: Lucy A.

description: Really great menu- variations on common dishes with a Asian fusion angle. Great service, great food. Butternut dumplings with Thai style ginger sauce, a career salad with ginger... Yum
author: Fleet H.

description:
Nothing I love better than catching up with old friends over an good meal.  Even better when those friends love food as much as I do.  I arrived early for our reservation and relaxed in the lounge area which looks like a very cool place for happy hour if I worked downtown.  

Between the four of us, we ordered a great array from the menu to try to get a variety of taste.  So many that I don't even know where to start.  But gotta start somewhere...

Lap souchong tea deviled eggs - love the nice bacon piece that accompanies this tasty appetizer.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#4QXUx98IgNFRx0fGgvQZtg
Ahi tuna poke - nice fresh flavors with good cuts of tuna http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#S50Gf__-pSdpvVSLO6dRqw
Salt and pepper calamari - a San Francisco standard dish.  Good flavor, not much different from others I have tried, generous portion.   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#T01zeONSElN8xVhW5Km3kQ
Satay platter - when you can't decide, just try them all.  And they were all tasty.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#cKQKuQcSyO-N9gj4nIFJNA
Wood roasted brocollini - this one was a good idea, but  bit too salty for me. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#45f9uPdd8wGjMgduc7Ql-w
Eggplant and tofu - two of my favorites.  Not oily which I usually expect out of a eggplant stir fry.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#fNSkIpUFKdgq_cTfwTZp8g
Roasted baby beets - The freshness and simple preparation was absolutely delicious! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#bZV7qZ3J6karOM29n73uRA
Indonesian corn fritters - These are another favorite.  Would love them to be a bit smaller though, but the size isn't going to stop me from devouring all of it.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#sXLEpAC1QUotuD8GO8G1YQ
Oxtail dumpling - OMG!  I could just eat these forever and be happy.  So tender and full of oxtail goodness!  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#kHlsHNccMBlPVfO1BY42XQ
Crispy fried local cod filet - Perfectly flashed fried piece was very moist and tasty.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#ehmJRH_hl4UdbUCVNSZ8Nw

As if that wasn't enough, we decided to order a couple desserts. 
Devil's food cake - Come on, it's chocolate.  You can't go wrong here.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#xoZIBRaK3bRl_WkiFAVHRQ
Bananamisu - If you're a banana lover, you have got to try this one!  So light!  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/if7l8HVMz7kmW0tG9l2LQA?select=k7iNkFgPa6De3bsx-WSduQ#YTGQPjaTL-3IOgbMFrXQlw

Whew, yeah, my friends and I can devour a lot of food.  What was great about this place is that the timing of plates and the service really allows you to spend your time relaxing and catching up with friends.  It's so nice to go somewhere where you can have a nice conversation over a great meal and not feel rushed to eat and run.  Plates were brought and cleared smoothly, water glasses always filled, staff very friendly and fun.  Personally for the price, I thought it was worth it for the quality of the meal and the setting.  

I bet this would be a great holiday and celebration gathering place.  Not that I need a special occasion to go back.  I just wished I still worked in SF and could get here more often. This would definitely be on my happy hour rotation if I did.  

Enjoy!
author: Maria S.

description:
Had to wait almost 2 months to get my E & O fix!! It looks amazing!! The decor has been updated and the menu has changed as well. We came here Friday night for dinner. It looks as though they have kept all of the classic e & o dishes but we could not resist trying all the new menu offerings. 

Cocktails: we came to have a drink in the lounge before our reservation. ( ok, so we had some corn fritter bites at the bar too. Not new but delicious )Glad to see that they still have happy hour. Amazing new exotic cocktails and what appeared to be a largely expanded wine list. A majority of which was being offered during happy hour. It's nice to see a place that doesn't just have well margaritas and salmon creek wine offered for their happy hour.

Stand out dishes:

Raw bar: 
Marin miyagi oysters. Kimchi cocktail sauce?! Shut the fu*k up, Delicious.

Salmon crudo. Served on a block of Himalayan rock salt. Delicious

Homemade pickle jars: we tried the rainbow carrot ones. I think there was coriander in it. Tart, crunchy, sweet, delicious.

Oxtail dumplings: rich, meaty, delicious.

Tamarind pork ribs: melt in your mouth, wood grilled, tangy tamarind glaze, delicious.

Wood grilled sirloin: sweet and spicy Korean pepper marinade, perfectly medium rare, radish kimchi, delicious.

Char siu black cod: ok, this one is not new, but we have to get it every time we come here. Favorite dish!!!

Can not wait to get back to try some of the other new dishes!! Welcome back E & O!!!!!!!
author: James L.

description: Love this place they have great food and a nice big open seating area! I recommend the papaya salad, brussel sprouts, chickpea curry fries and the dumplings!
author: Julia ..

description:
Cute atmosphere. Food on the pricey side. Wait staff outstanding. Can't say same for the "hostess". Snarky attitude. We made the mistake of sitting in the dinning seats near the bar during 'happy hour' and she informed me we had to leave the table in an hour since happy hour will be over in an hour. She must have forgotten she works in a service industry. Telling a customer to leave is probably not what management would like their 'hostess' to tell customers. She didn't know that we would not be staying for dinner or planning to order few more drinks. We moved over to the proper bar area to get away from her. People that work in service industry should leave the attitude at the door and do the job they are hired to do.

Response to question from E&O
This was my second visit to the restaurant. My first visit was lunch with a co worker. My second visit was happy hour on my date and we both do not plan to be back.
author: Mab Q.

description: Fantastic ambience & food delicious...sexy & elegant San Francisco late night great choice. Funky mood music & stylish guests.
author: Sunny B.

description:
I've been to E&O many times but not often since law school. Thanks to an amazing recent Yelp event, I've already been back twice.

This is a great choice if you are rushed and want great drinks and filling appetizers (bahn mi sliders, corn fritters, etc.) or just need to duck out of the rain and warm up. 

The lighting, vibe, and open air make this place a very appealing spot for both HHR and private parties.

If there is one negative, it's that this place can be very popular and filled with people, especially shoppers/tourists around the holidays.  I generally avoid Union Square and the surrounding 6 blocks in December, but E&O is just close enough to the Stockton Garage (and it's Bush st. entrance) to make an easy getaway.
author: Mike V.

description: The butternut squash dumplings are my favorite. The fried rice is perfectly spicy and has unique flavors. The corn fritters are very good and the cocktails are also great. The only reason I can't rate E and O 5 stars is because we ordered over $500 worth of food and we had dishes that were untouched. We asked to take the leftovers home and they were thrown out by our server. This was unacceptable.
author: H K.

description: We loved this place! We were running late and showed up 20 minutes past our reservation, but they still found a place for us and accommodated our needs. The food was delicious and the decorations were beautiful - we will definitely return in the future.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
This review is based on the Yelp Elite event. The space is gorgeous, and I loved how they moved all the tables and chairs - it really opened the place up.  For the event we had the following:

-Corn Fritter - waste of calories, sadly.  I had one piece, and didn't care for it for the rest of the night. It was really nothing to write home about and was greasy frankly.

-Chicken Satay - chicken breast was dry and not enough satay sauce. It was one dimensional. 

-Spicy French Fry Boats (forget the actual name) - how can you go wrong with french fries? You can't! They were good, but again they were more fries and sauce than anything else. I believe there was supposed to be toppings? 

-Banh Mi Sliders - best item of the night. These sliders rocked my taste buds off my tongue. They had a nice savory, sweet and salty combination. The picked vegetables married well with the shredded pork.  It was a decent portion too.  I would say that the sliders increased this rating from a 2 start to a three star.

Needless to say, based on the yelp event, I would not return as a paying customer.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Came here for dinner with a friend, during HH, and unfortunately the experience was just OK. I ordered the Japanese bop and she ordered the Asian gnocchi. 
My dish was just okay, was very tiny and overall the flavors were ok. Also quite expensive for how little the plate was... can definitely get yummy and less expensive Asian "fusion" food elsewhere.

The service was also just okay. The waitress was a bit off. Came with 2 glasses of wine after we had only ordered one for myself. She also brought out the dessert menu while my friend was still eating her meal!

Probably wouldn't come back unfortunately.
author: Siv L.

description: Great atmosphere!! Happy hour food was amazing. Oysters were super small which explains the dollar in price. Fried rice was awesome.
author: Jonathan L.

description: One of the best happy hours in the city. I highly recommend this place for their 3pm happy-hour. There are $1 oysters and $4 beers. Also, highly recommend the corn fritters and the butternut squash dumplings.
author: Nate W.

description:
I recently ate lunch at E&O for the first time... The bartender was friendly, but a bit slow and fairly busy. I had heard this place used to be known for incredible asian fusion dishes, but my plate of pad kee mao was fairly bland and uninspired. Prices are a bit expensive when you can get better food at other places for less

The cocktail menu looked interesting though

Not bad, but not great
author: Steve K.

description: This place should definitely be the "IT PLACE" food was amazing, ambience was super, and staff was very nice! Oysters and ahi tuna were my favorite.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Food is yummy! The dumplings are great! We had the chicken & prawns Satay and they where also very yummy! My kids had the drunken noodles and loved them! Service was not so great, I think they where just too busy.
author: Cynthia P.

description: We went here with few folks from our office and other colleagues from another company. In one word I would say: avoid this place. I got violently sick that afternoon and was sick all night and the next day. When you get sick at a restaurant who cares about anything else.
author: Paolo D.

description:
Pretty good diversity of food- mostly Asian. My group of 3 ordered a smorgasbord of small dishes for dinner like ribs, tuna, edamame, and some other tasty sides. A good way to taste a bunch of different foods and mix and match. The food was probably about a 3.5, but I was still pleased with my order. 

Service was good- had a nice waiter who was helpful in picking out options to eat. The interior of the restaurant was very modern and cool. It had two different floors, overall was very impressed by the inside. 

I would suggest this for a group of friends looking for a cool and sleek place to eat, for lunch or for dinner!
author: Tim S.

description: This is my 5th time at this restaurant. I like their cocktail choices, small plates, and flatiron steak. I ordered the Japanese Bop on Wednesday night for the first time and I don't understand why that's even on the menu. The pickles, egg, and hard rice cake didn't go well together.
author: Shiva A.

description:
I had lunch with a group at E&O. The ambience of the restaurant is nice but it gets very loud, making it difficult to have a conversation across the table even. Service is very good. Our server was very helpful with dietary restrictions and highlighting items on the menu. The menu is varied and has gluten-free items noted. 

Unfortunately, the execution of the menu is disappointing. I tried a number of appetizers. The corn fritter is an interesting idea but it tastes dry and uninteresting. In contrast, the ribs were too salty. The rice crackers that accompanied the tuna tartare were stale. And the calamari was fine, but not memorable. I also had the Chinese chicken salad, which is one of the few menu items that isn't fried or oily, but it's pretty bland. 

Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Esther C.

description: Came for Happy hour, dumplings and the blushing geisha are amazing! The rice bowl was incredibly good.
author: Shaila B.

description: Service was great, but I ordered the pad thai and it was the blandest pad thai I ever ate. $18 for that meal during lunch was way overpriced. It's like they forgot to add soy sauce.
author: F Z.

description: Awesome small plates. Butternut squash tortellini and corn fritters with Aslan sauce are not to be missed. Nice ambiance and service. Great place to relax after the hustle on Union Square.
author: Scott G.

description:
I came here for a working lunch. The food and service was fantastic.

Service:
Very prompt and friendly. It was lunch and did not wait at all. May be different during dinner

Food:
We had a variety of food, which we all split. 

1. Fried fritters. Amazing. The sauce it came with really made the dish and kept me breaking off more and more pieces 

2. Cod. It was like butter. I don't care much for fish and ate most of the dish! 

3. Beef dish. It was a spicy beef and vegetables and was that perfect spicy where it had a good kick, but didn't have me scrambling for water. 

4. Bread dish. The sauces to dip in we're great.

Overall:
I will be coming back for dinner and I will recommend to friends. Very happy with my experience here.
author: Robert R.

description:
Came here on a trip to SF and really enjoyed it!  The service was great, and the food was even better.

We ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari, the Chicken Spring Rolls, and the Beef Satay.  It was plenty of food for two people, and we didn't even finish the side of rice we ordered with it.  The flavors were all really exotic and interesting.  The marinade on the steak was really tasty!

I also got the Yuzu Margarita which was really good!  My husband got the Moscow Mule which I thought was great, but it was pretty strong on the ginger (which he didn't like as much).

Overall, we were extremely happy!!
author: Megan P.

description:
A Yelp event brought me to an area of town I don't normally go out in. Bartenders were chill and cool, staff was attentive and nice. Also, I can never complain about free drinks & apps - it was fun overall, but here's a more specific breakdown of what I tried:

~~DRINKS~~
* 5 Sexy Stars - 3.5 stars
(blue angel vodka, passionfruit, lemongrass, lime)
A light drink, refreshing, good for summer.

* The Elitist - 4 stars
(blue angel vodka, thai basil, lime)
My fave drink - has a bit of that tart flavor that I love in a cocktail.

* Call for Yelp! - 2.5 stars
(kaapa pisco, pomegranate, ginger)
Ok, even for me - someone with a major sweet tooth - this was WAY too sweet! Wouldn't have predicted given the ingredients.. and I'm a huge ginger fan as well.

~~FOOD~~
* Fries - 4 stars
I'm not sure why everyone seems to discount these fries. Maybe I ate one of the very first batch that came out, which were really warm and fresh. I thought they were awesome - crisped just right, warm but with a crunch, and the scallions added a nice fresh zest.

* Corn fritters - 4 stars
The fritters were sweet, the breading crunchy and crisp, the dip intense and savory. 

* Chicken satay - 3 stars
Dry! Way too dry. The sauce was really watery too, which was difficult to handle when it's a starter being passed around with no plates to eat off of.

* Beef sliders - 3.5 stars
Not bad, the meat was tender and the sauce good. Just wish there was more of the actual meat. The buns were a little on the dry side, the outside was buttery and slightly toasted but it should have been toasted a little more to get a good crisp.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Walked past this restaurant several times ...

Had no reservation for Valentine's Day (on vacation), but took a chance ...

Got a table for myself, wife and two daughters!  Food was excellent, waitress' suggestions were excellent, and so was the service.  Speakeasy Payback Porter beer was delicious, as were the corn fritters that the waitress recommended.  Daughter loved her ribs ...

Great service and didn't treat us like tourists !!!  Thanks !!!
author: Frank M.

description: I really like this but the lemon is one of my favorite dishes there make sure you go through happy hour they have really good deals I believe the happy hour is from 3 to 7.
author: johnny W.

description:
We happened upon this place after strolling around looking for a good happy hour. 
We were definitely not dressed up, but felt at home at this bar! 
The chairs were so comfortable, the happy hour menu simple yet creative, the cocktails were very cheap and delicious, and everyone made us feel at home. 

The staff was kind, and unassuming. The bar tending was on point. 
WE ESPECIALLY LOVED TRISTAN. 
What a delight. He was attentive, sweet, and even joined in our girl talk at the perfect moments. Well done sir. 

There was basketball on the TV, it was just noisy enough that catching up with girlfriends (laughing, yelling, light shrieking) was perfectly fine. 

All in all, a great experience. I will be back. 
For the Kentucky Mules! (And Tristan) 
Check this place out.
author: Erika B.

description:
Himalayan stir -fry.. the flavor wasn't bad..it had chinese bbq pork along with shrimp and other veggies..

the ckn lettuce wrap had no chicken..n i didn't know it had rice in it..it looked exactly like the Himalayan stir-fry except it was way more salty..gah..

the Indonesian beef curry was ok..the flavor of the curry was good..the veggie were a bit hard..but it was fine for my tasting..just not so for my parents..the beef wasn't stewed beef..it was hanger steak beef.. a bit of an odd combination..it wasn't that great..maybe try it with another type of beef..stewed beef would of been nice..

the satay..chicken and mushroom was pretty good..altho the mushroom was more on the burnt side..the chicken was really good along with the pickled cucumber..the sauce on the other hand was too vinegary and almost tasted like alcohol..

the place is a bit pricey for the size..and taste of food..but i have to give it to you that the bathroom and decor..was stellar..a nice place for some wine..maybe happy hour?

i came for lunch..i'm guessing the dinner menu is almost the same..but you won't catch me here again.
author: Minerva L.

description:
For an Asian restaurant I was expecting more or should I rather say diverse menu. I came across this place through my hotels magazine listing places to eat. Well after looking over the menu for a good 10 minutes I picked the standard go to item a hamburger. 

The hamburger was "Asian infused" with kimchi. Though it wasn't nearly the best kimchi I've ever had. On top of this I ordered medium rare but was given rare instead. This later on caused issue in the bathroom. 

The only redeeming factor for the establishment was the friendly bar staff. 

Oh and the drinks were weak.
author: Jonathon H.

description: The cuisine was good the wait was a bit long but it was worth it.  The service however was top notch so it offset the wait time.
author: Trevor N.

description:
Formerly E&O Trading Co, now renamed E&O Asian Kitchen.  The decor and floodplain layout updated.
