description: What a perfect cafe in the heart of the City.  Great food, tapas, and atmosphere.  It was great service, delicious food ....must go back !
author: Lori S.

description: Average. My brother and I got fried rice and it was okay. My mother and father seemed to enjoy their for and chicken with lettuce. Service was good.
author: Ari G.

description: I think I have had this placed bookmarked for at least 4 years, and I finally got the chance to try it out! Unfortunately, I was not hungry enough to try as much as I would have liked, but I got a good idea of the place. First of all, the interior design is great! I really enjoyed the ambiance of the place. The workers were also very nice, we had a party of 4 and they only had room for 3 at the bar, but they let us just squeeze and put in a 4th chair. We got the "pu pu platted" (LOL) and it was really good! It had tuna tartar with very fresh tuna. It had these corn biscuit like things that also were very good, and from the food network channel. It had some short ribs, which melted off the tongue. It also had chicken satay, which was very standard, but I can't complain. We also got the drunken noodles, which came in a very small serving for the price, but I can't complain..it is Union Square. But I will surely come back to give more of their items a try! And I have to try their Moscow Mule....
author: Nikita K.

description:
This restaurant has some of the best vegetarian dishes I've ever tasted.   Their "Butternut Squash Dumplings", "Shittake Mushroom Dumplings", and "Portabella Mushroom Sattay" were absolutely delicious (and I don't normally like squash or mushrooms!).

The Dried Fried Green Beans and Roasted Eggplant were good as well, but if I go back, I will stay with the first three items I mentioned.
author: Rob N.

description:
Everything we ordered looked amazing on the menu but the flavors didn't quite deliver. It's like they went out and did some research to figure out what's popular in food, stuck it on their menu but didn't really do it right.

Steamed pork buns were totally gross. The bun was soggy and over stuffed with mushy pulled pork. You'd think kimchi would be good on this but it just didn't go well with the pork. This was the one thing left of the table that no one in our group would finish.

Oxtail dumplings were bland. I think they were going for the mexi-asian fusion but this didn't work. The five spice sauce was watery and all I could taste was black beans.

Green papaya salad was very sour, perhaps too much lime juice.

There were two redeeming dishes on the menu. Beef in the Toppoki was really good and well seasoned. Corn fritters were good but a bit over fried. Much better than their old corn fritters though.

I miss the old E&O decor.It now looks like a hotel lobby.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Amazing food! Price is fab for the quality at happy hour. Setting is nice too. We arrived at 5:50pm so had ordered 2 drinks each to make the most happy hour but the waitress came back and said we were not allowed which I found outrageous! It was within happy hour time and we would have stayed for more drinks. I'd get it if it was 5 drinks each but 2! Give us a break!
author: Kelly M.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for Drinks and Appetizers.  They sat us in the main dining area since they were full.  The cocktail are Great and the Pork buns are to die for.  We ordered three apps and second order of the pork buns.  I would highly recommend it for a date night.  

Great service, our water was never half empty, and our server was very pleasant.
author: Cara C.

description:
LITERALLY ONE OF THE WORST RESTAURANTS I'VE EVER BEEN TO.

My girlfriend and I just arrived to San Francisco after a long drive from Cambria. We've both lived in New York City and many other great cities across the country and it was our first time in San Francisco. We were staying in Union Square and looking for something quick to eat nearby our hotel. We discovered E&O online - it looked solid and was close by so we decided to give it a try.

By far - this was the single worst decision of our entire 2-week California trip. The food was beyond average, and it was almost not worthy of a review. But I had to come on here to give fair warning to everyone else to never go in this place.

We started with the famous "corn fritters"- these were literally giant fried balls of corn kernels that tasted bland and were just completely bizarre. It's almost laughable that this dish is their version of "creativity."

My girlfriend ordered the Drunken Noodles. There was hardly any ground pork in it (which the menu claimed it had) and the vegetables were absolutely awful. This dish literally tasted like it belonged under the "Asian Cuisine" section of a Cheesecake Factory menu. Truly one of the worst "fusion" noodle dishes I've ever tasted. I ordered the Steak Satay and it was completely average. The meat was far too chewy and the peanut sauce it was served with was entirely irrelevant and didn't mesh with the entree. 

Perhaps this place has a decent happy our or appetizer selection, but I can't figure out why it has above a 1 star average rating on Yelp. We were so excited to try the amazing food in San Francisco and were extremely disappointed that this was our first pick. We will NEVER be back here. This city has some incredible food (as evident by the last few days of our trip) - do not waste your time even walking into this place.
author: David R.

description: My husband, son and I dined out on Friday, February 19th and had a wonderful time. The best part of our experience was the service. Tim, our server, was so attentive, we felt like royalty. He was very stealth about his approach and so it was never intrusive or overbearing - it was just perfect. Seriously. I was amazed. Give a nod for another drink? Bam! It's there. Tim also helped us pick the perfect cocktails and his reviews were spot on. I tried the bourbon with lime and it was excellent. Smooth and refreshing at the same time. It must be said that I am rarely a cocktail lover. And the other staff who cleared our table throughout our dining experience were equally stealth. All were gracious. I really recommend dining here. The atmosphere is classy and contemporary - and elegantly comfortable. Making reservations on Open Table was a breeze - even when we had to change it twice due to traffic! I called E & O immediately after making a change to ensure they received it (that would be too efficient right? I mean, for electronic-to-restaurant communication in a minute or so?) and they already had! So, you can trust Open Table - it really does calculate open and closed reservations spots to the T. Again, a big shout out to Tim who made the experience memorable. We shall return!
author: Deborah B.

description:
Pork steam buns and oxtail dumplings were not bad. Also ordered the Dan Dan Noodels, it was ok, nothing special... 

Server was nice, service was ok.

Not a place I'd go again unless nothing else is around.
author: Sway M.

description:
decent food, but pretty expensive. think pf chengs with more class.

There are MANY other unique, special, Chinese restaurants in the city, first in mind would be Burma Superstar. The food is pretty good, but dishes were overall inconsistant. 

Ahi Poke- Delicious, very very tender and fresh. Well, seasoned, spot on flavor. Portion reminiscent or a happy meal. Homemade rice crackers tasted like a grainy white chocolate. 

Himalayan Red Rice Stir Fry- Best item of the night. Balanced between sweet and salty, not drenched in soy sauce or over powred with sesame oil. Shrimp is cooked perfectly, not sure if i was loving the giant pieces of pork.

Beef Satay- INEDIBLY SALTY. So so so so so so salty. Meat itself was too firm, and over cooked. The pickled veggies on the side sort of toned down the flavor, but not enough.  

Those two appetizers, plus the stir fry, and two drinks tallied an unexpected $85. I don't mind paying for delicious San Francisco-caliber food, but this is a far cry from it. I  expect this quality from San Jose, but not from you, San Francisco.
author: Peter T.

description:
Stopped by after ice skating with my daughter. needed a quick bite close to the garage.
Layout is the same as the old E&O but remodeled since fire. Menu has familiar items.
Surprisingly generous portions of the lettuce cups and shaking beef. Lettuce cups made with organic chicken (major plus). Beef is quality meat. 
Corn fritters are still yum but a bit pricy for 3 pieces.  
Service was ok... Seemingly younger inexperienced crew (most look like they are right out of high school and trying to be tres chic in their Forever 21 outfits, and that's exaggerating their sense of style). Our waiter was decent in that he did the bare minimum, but this may be his first gig at a nice establishment.  

the new resto has potential but they will have to change up the staff if they want to charge their high end rates. food is ok.... but then again the food at the old E&O was hit or miss as well.

hey, if you are a tourist, you will probably LOVE this place
author: joyce l.

description:
Wow, I've walked past here many times but finally took my woman here for our anniversary. We had corn fritters-to die for, Dan-dan noodles-ok, chicken.satay-good, and the short-rib sliders-soooo good!
Decor was nice, service was great, they also have happy hour specials... Highly recommended.
author: Thanh P.

description:
Enjoyed a lovely dinner for four on a Saturday night. 
Awesome food - great service - lovely atmosphere.
The Butternut Squash dumplings were awesome. The Corn Fritters were amazing too.
The Indonesian fried rice was very flavorful too. 
The close proximity to Union Square makes this a perfect location for dinner after a busy day of shopping.
author: Marsha C.

description:
The food is B+ good and the restaurant is attractive. A major negative is the noise. It is very, very loud, especially if you are sitting at the sort of bar-stool tables in the center. For our reservation for six, they had no room for normal tables or booths, so we had no choice but to sit with our party at the large bar-stool style tables. 

This does not work. It is so loud and you are seated so far from each other that it destroyed the ability to have a group conversation. So, if we were to do it again and that was the only option, I'd say emphatically no and find another restaurant.

For two or three people this might be fine, but not for a larger group.

I thought the corn fritters were ok, kind of pedestrian. Would not order them again.

The fried rice dish is good, not great. In fact, I would say that is true of all the entrees we ordered. Thus, it felt over-priced. You are sitting in a nice restaurant in downtown San Francisco so you expect to be charged too much, I suppose.

Maybe the thing to do is to order exotic drinks and let the food be secondary in importance.
author: Mister K.

description: Came for the happy hour based on the reviews. Ordered a dozen of oyster with my girlfriends. Initially we wanted to try other snacks but we were very disappointed with the oysters. There were so many broken shells. Some of the oysters were broken into pieces. When the waiter checked on us, we thought it might be good to let them know for other customers' good. But he didn't take it well yet he answered: "we needed pressure to open the oysters and it is normal to have broken shells inside the oysters." Then we decided to leave. Broken shells, it's quite acceptable; broken pieces of oysters, it was actually very disgusting.
author: Natalie L.

description: Great for happy hour or dinner. Impressive service from the entire staff. Order the butternut squash ravs.
author: Vicki L.

description: Went to eat here a couple of months ago - mix Asian fusion cuisine in a really happening environment.  Caution: make reservations.  Place was packed on a Tuesday night, and it was early.  The hostess asked if we had RSVPs - we said no - she was so cool and hip, said hold on, sat us within 5 minutes at a table.  Servers were awesome - they made some great recommendations - we ordered multiple appetizers, entrees and desserts. All were very good.  Will be headed back, but definitely with reservations made.
author: Nick K.

description: Server Chris was very attentive. This is a huge plus and deserved the 5 stars because of it. Shaking beef is excellent as well as the Moscow mule and their calamari appetizer.
author: Rose P.

description: Stopped by for some happy hour drinks and snacks.  The restaurant looks great, staff is wonderful, food/drinks were satisfying.  Will definitely be back.
author: Dilly M.

description: Good Asian fusion food, ambience and great beverages.  Took the team out for a dinner there and we had a good time.
author: V G.

description: Came here for the first time. Was great to see the gluten free options. Service was good and we all had a good time. The window seats really are not for four which is a shame.
author: David N.

description:
Got my review removed but here, i'll gladly post it again. The name now removed due to "privacy reasons" but the name of the Director of Catering at E&O's isn't hard to search for. http://www.eosanfrancisco.com/team/

I was recommended by a co-worker to host a team event at E & O because she had a good experience there dining with her friends. It is the holiday season so I was thrilled that they had an opening for a group of 18. I started to coordinate the event with their Director of Catering through email. She was extremely unpleasant to work with and didn't pay attention to the details. I had an attendee with extreme dietary restrictions and asked to prepare a special menu. I gave her a list of all the allergies and food preferences but she would respond with ideas that I clearly wrote in the email as an allergy. After some back and forth, she asked to speak with the person directly when we arrived on the day of the reservation instead of preparing the menu prior. As an event planner, I wanted to make sure that all the attendees will be enjoying their time so I wanted to make sure the menu was up to expectations prior to their arrival. After a couple days, she presented a menu. I also requested for a vegetarian menu. 

When we arrived, the party was split into two tables in their upper level dining area. Of course we did not want to be separated. I told the waiter, James, and he was helping us see if we can all fit in one table. He was absolutely wonderful. When the Director of Catering arrived, she didn't introduce herself - she just went to start moving things around. When I said I didn't realize that the tables were going to be separated, she kept saying "it was on the paper I sent you". Sure, she was correct but I would've appreciated it if she were to tell me that this was going to be the case especially since this was my first time hosting an event there. Not only that but when I tried to explain, she kept mumbling the same thing "it was on the paper I sent you" and was completely dismissive to anything I had to say. Eventually, after some moving around, we were able to be seated at one table because some folks didn't show up. She added a small table at the end for an extra person that would show up later. She was fumbling around and having some trouble with setting it up and I kept hearing her just cuss in the corner. Very professional. 

Now onto the food. The appetizers showed up and they weren't great - definitely not worth the price but edible. All the appetizers showed up and the attendee with the dietary restrictions did not even receive his first appetizer. I then asked where are the dishes for the vegetarian attendee and Director of Catering proceeds to tell me that "he can eat the prepared appetizers that are vegetarian". I did not pay $75 dollar for my vegetarian guest so that he can eat 2/4 appetizers and one dish of fried rice. I expected a full vegetarian menu and substitutes of what would've been the regular menu. She also said that he can share the dishes that were specially made for the guest with dietary restrictions. WHAT? The vegetarian attendee did not have the same allergies and did not need to eat those dishes. The salad course came, and both of them had a plate of lettuce - i'm not kidding. Pure lettuce. I then told the waiter to grab some croutons because the vegetarian can eat croutons, unlike the other guest. 

The main entrees came and the salmon was flavorless and the chicken was dry. The bak choy and mushrooms didn't even look presentable. Most people barely touched their food. The restaurant's saving grace is that they had alcohol so people can be distracted. 

I spoke to Jeremy, the manager in the end. He was able to listen and hopefully really do something about this. Again, James was great to work with. He always came by with a smile and was really accommodating. 

In all, I would never come back and I would not recommend anyone else to plan an event here, especially for this kind of service.
author: Sharon H.

description:
Let me state that the flavors were really great. The duck roll, salads, corn fritters, and even the dukbokki (toppoki) were tasty, creative, and the textures were great. I really like the sauces. A bunch of went for lunch, so we were able to sample different dishes. 

The waiter was really helpful and I liked the chairs. 

So why the 3 star? I think it's a bit overpriced for what it is. It's high end Asian fusion, and I think I would frequent this place given the prices.  The lighting also kept changing which was odd. I definitely recommend going during lunch if you have a work lunch or want to treat someone. The atmosphere is great and the chairs are comfy.
author: Wendy L.

description: Came here with a large group. The food was really good, not too heavy. I loved the salmon and the chocolate cake for desert.
author: Virginia M.

description:
I was invited by my Elite Yelp friend, they were hosting the Yelp holiday party. It was a cool party. Simple and fun. I hadn't heard of this restaurant before so it was nice to try something new.

They cleared the dance floor and had some great music playing. The staff was awesome. I will return for dinner sometime.
author: Jenna P.

description:
I don't know how I hadn't heard of this place...but a friend suggested it...and I am glad they did.  Located a few blocks off Union square on sutter...Hmm, as I remind the inner control freak...sometimes its nice when other people make decisions...

Went there at 3:30 on a Saturday.  it wasn't by any means crowded, but had enough people milling about so I didn't feel as though I was drinking alone, as my friend got the non-alcoholic pineapple spritz which they did not take more than two sips of. 

The happy hour bar menu is great.  Has quite a few cocktails, beer options and wine.  I got a basic cab sauv...it was good.  Sat at the bar...there was a tv so I could watch a little of the game...

we ordered a bunch of bites off of the bar menu.  These tuna poppers, which was probably the best thing I ate all day.  The tuna was nicely seasoned, very fresh and light, in a fried and crispy little basket ...we ordered two, then two more.  We ordered a dozen oysters of whatever they had that day.  Fresh again, very tasty.  We had a portabello mushroom on a skewer, meaty, light and it came with a little pile of cut up pickled veggies...

when the bill came we were disappointed, because the pumpkin dumplings were on there and we were reminded that we never actually received them...sadface squared...

Besides forgetting part of the order, then charging us for it anyway, then not really apologizing for it...it was also disappointing that they didn't even once comment on the fact that my friend left an entire drink there...usually servers at least like to know what was up...and there weren't enough people there to even blame the crowd...so it was the service that took the stars away...and thats a shame...
author: Kierstan G.

description:
what a beautiful place.

I had never been to E&O trading company before its a million buck renovation, but when they re-opened, it had been on my list for a long time.. well, not a long time.

First of all, its decor is great. they kept it sophisticated, and modern. Thank god, it didn't become another one of those tacky looking restaurants. I just loved the whole wooden thing around me.

Food - excellent.. we had a bit of heavy brunch (they serve lunch menu instead of brunch on weekends which I love). It was a great mixture of asian cuisines with californian flare. The char siu black cod and japanese bop were delicious.. especially the bop!

I would love to go back for more sometime!
author: Sung C.

description: I planned a work team dinner for 22 people had a really evening and can't say enough good things about this place.  Great ambiance in a private seating area upstairs.  Appetizers were tasty and plentiful and the main course, served family style was really full of surprising fresh and interesting flavors.  What really made this a 5 star experience was the wait staff who were super nice, interactive and extremely helpful.  Thank you James, Maribel and Dawn your excellent customer service made this such a pleasant experience.
author: C K.

description:
Great place close to union square.

Went with a friend and we shared two apps and each had an entree. 

The corn fritters was the star of the meal hands down. 

Service was helpful and perfectly timed.  

Highly recommend this place.
author: Chad J.

description:
This is a cute place with really nice decor and a cool atmosphere. The service left a little to be desired for (she was definitely in the weeds) but the food was good. I liked the smaller portion menu they had which allowed us to try a couple of things which all turned out to be really good. The dumplings are to die for.

The prices were decent, nothing too outrageous, and the drinks were good.
Next time I'm in San Fran I might just check them out again
author: Michele D.

description: The ambiance is fantastic. Just north of Union Square on Sutter St. Fabulous place for Happy Hour food and drinks in the bar. Dinner here is nice too, but the customer service could be better. A good place for light bites and drinks to get your evening started. If you do come here for dinner, the Beef Short Rib Sliders are a must-try. Parking is a cinch, since the Sutter-Stockton garage is right around the corner.
author: Jen O.

description:
Our firm held a 30 person cocktail hour at E&O during a very busy time this September. They did a great job of identifying and working with our needs, and answering any questions (thanks, Claudie!) In addition, they weren't trying to get money from us but instead were interested in helping us achieve our vision.

The event turned out great, and everyone enjoyed the food, ambiance, and service. We will most certainly book this venue again for future events!

Thank you!
author: Molly H.

description:
We went to E&O for valentines day dinner and had a wonderful time. The food was excellent and the staff were very friendly and attentive. We were seated upstairs which was a little quieter and the tables were set up quite far apart for a more intimate experience. The waiter James gave some great menu recommendations. 

For drinks,my boyfriend had the Singapore sling which was delicious, very flavorful. I had a blushing geisha which was just okay. A little bland. We started with the corn fritters which were light and tasty. Then had the butternut squash dumplings which were incredible, we considered ordering a second round they were that good. We also had their crispy pork belly salad, also excellent. For entrees we had the shaking beef and the fried rice. Both were good though the butternut squash dumplings were the all star of the meal for me. Would definitely return next time we're in the city.
author: Jennifer E.

description:
Nice trendy restaurant. The list of appetizer/small dishes appeared very appealing Which made it difficult to decide whether to go with several appetizers or an appetizer and a main course. With the guidance of the server I went with multiple appetizers.

Had the Indonesian Corn Fritters which were excellent.
Beef short rib sliders, which were ok. The size of the bun overwhelmed the short rib filling so all in all this app was disappointing.
Shitake Mushroom Dumplings - were ok to good.
The Dry Fried Green Beans were good.

So all in all I would give it 3 stars. I think one of the issues encountered is that I went with a diverse amount/type of food that did not work together.

I would give it a second try and would go for the main course Black Pepper Shaking Steak  that my server convinced me to do on another occasion.
author: Mitchell M.

description: Skewered portobello mushrooms here tasked like beef skewers. How did they do that? It was one of the best things I have ever eaten. Great Ambiance and wife open seating. Great area on the outskirts of union square.
author: Ryan C.

description:
It just happened to be Happy Hour when we went...what a great deal!  We got the Pu Pu Platter, oysters, and the dumplings.

Oysters - a little smaller than what I am used to, but still tasty and great price.  The sauce that comes with it was very good.

Butternut squash dumplings ***DELICIOUS*** very very very good, loved them

Corn Fritters - good, felt like I needed to dip it in something, but still good.

Sliders - Just ok

Ribs - very very good, fell right off the bone

Chicken Satay - good, nothing special.

Ahi Tartar - good

For a place that we just stumbled upon, the place was A-OK!
author: Michelle K.

description: Came here for the Dine about town in June and sadly realized after we arrived on a Saturday night that of course Saturday night was not included for the special. We of course stayed, just bummed that we did not get to enjoy the special menu. Our server was nice and prompt. I ordered the Blushing Geisha drink which I did not really care for, and our server noticed without me even saying a word. He offered to bring me another drink, so I ordered a special Manila drink. That was slightly better so I sipped on that. We ordered the Indonesian Corn Fritters( of course a must), Short Rib Sliders (very tasty and moist), Beef Toppoki ( this was good, only I asked for medium cooked and it came back rare) and the Prawn salad is a definite must order. Overall, the food and prices are decent. I will attempt to come back next time during the Dine about town and not on a Saturday for sure.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Food is tasty,but much to noisy,can't hear yourself talk or your companion.
Waitstaff is very attentive .
author: Renee B.

description: Came here with my mom for her company party and honestly none of the food was good. The appetizers were decent, but it came off to me as trying too hard to be fancy Asian food. The beef skewers weren't bad, and probably my best dish of the evening, but the fried corn fritters? (didn't catch the name) didn't have flavor unless you dipped it in sauce. The duck lettuce wrap was also not flavorful, and the goat cheese and raddish bruschetta wasn't good to me only because I'm not a fan of goat cheese. The bread was nice and crispy and the raddish we as good but mixed with the goat cheese just threw me off. Dinner was served family style, with fried rice, plain rice, fried chicken (that was black o_O), salmon (didn't have much flavor but the mango coconut sauce was good), and I didn't enjoy the vegetable dish either. My only favorite part of the evening was the good service. The bartender made my mom a Cosmo where we requested it to be less alcohol and sweeter. She loved it. And asked for his best cocktail and he made me a Gazebo (pineapple flavored). I had about 4 glasses of those and it was delicious! Everyone at my table even ordered it after tasting mine. The champagne served wasn't bad either. Don't think I will be returning here, not a fan.
author: Amanda C.

description: Service was not good.   When we spoke to a manager all he could say was it was very very busy. He basically made an excuse for the poor service.  We used to love this place. They failed to deliver the rice  on  time. We never got the water spinach (which we were billed for.    The Shaking beef and papaya salad saved a very poor night. Ok had to edit.  After the manager offered free desert, we waited 15 minutes for the food server to take our order.  And here is what compd desert looks like
author: jennifer w.

description: Great food, amazing service...be sure to sit at the bar for the best experience!  The bartenders cater and tailor to you likings and make it a delightful, effortless experience. The drunken noodles are a must.
author: L L.

description:
The food was good, we really enjoyed our dishes that were composed of fresh fish and vegetables (yup, i'm dieting....)
But the service was a bit too fast and rushed so the experience lasted 45 minutes, if that. 
The setting is pretty cool, and we were there late after a college alumni event so there wasn't a huge crowd which was nice b/c I fathom this place could be loud.
author: Mrs. A.

description:
If you're in the city and looking for some great Asian food with an amazing atmosphere, I suggest you check out E&O Asian Kitchen.  I recently went there with my wife and another couple and we had a great time trying a bunch of their dishes.  Their plates are somewhat small, so we decided to try a few "family style".  We had the satay sampler platter, naan, dumplings (butternut squash and mushroom), fritters, bbq pork ribs, and lettuce wraps.  Everything was good, including the wine!  

The atmosphere is great (they recently completed a large remodel) and the service was good.  The only disappointment was that they were out of their chocolate cake dessert, but we settled for the ginger cookies to-go and they were simply amazing!
author: Marc N.

description: Went there last Friday night, food was awesome, service was ok cuz we were just sitting at the bar. I will definitely go back because of their food.
author: Kai G.

description:
February 7th, 2015
Atmosphere was very nice, and the staff was nice but slow. Takes a while for drinks as everyone orders specialty cocktails. No excuse, get another bar tender. This coming from people who live in New Orleans and would like to have their drinks or wine while they have their dinner. With that said, the food we had was excellent. Satay is great, not the boring standard peanut sauce, shrimp satay with jalapeño and basil sauce was awesome. The pickled veggies on the side (pickled in house) were some of the best I have tasted. Shrimp rice was excellent. Pot stickers were very good. I heard everyone raving about the corn fritters, although we did not try them, looked delicious.
author: Mark B.

description: We went there for drinks and maybe a bite based on the concierge's recommendation. The cocktails lived up to their name- have the punch with pineapple, it was delish. The pumpkin dumplings were lovely too but that is really were it ended. The service was slow- made promises for water, setting our table, getting our drinks etc - but forgot! I received my second cocktail AFTER we had finished the meal despite ordering the cocktail at the same time as other dishes. :( This place was overpriced too and overrated for the traffic it was getting- hate giving bad reviews but I wish I didn't waste $100 on this place, and would not recommend it.
author: Tamara S.

description: Great service , intimate atmosphere, Enjoyed the food very much! Had the pad Thai, the rib sliders, and the corn fritter. All was delicious the rib sliders being my favorite. The waitress was great in giving us recommendation's.
author: Carolina S.

description: I would have given this place 5 stars, there food is really awesome, but they need to work out their hours. My husband & I attended a Giants game in late August, on a Friday night. We ran from the ball park to E&O to get there before it closed. Made it to the door at 9:55, i know because after I tried the door to only find it locked, i looked at my watch, my phone & my husband's phone to double check the time. I tried calling (there were still people inside) I couldn't get through to anyone! I had raved to my to my husband about the corn fritters & deviled eggs. Was so disappointed when he didn't get to try them. We were starving, luckily there was an Irish pub open around the corner!
author: Victoria C.

description: Came here for a work dinner on a Tuesday night, which was still pretty busy. Overall, definitely a good experience. Very trendy decor, open and airy, modern. The food was above average, better than I had expected, especially after reading some of the reviews here.  I would definitely come back if I wanted a nice dinner around Union Square. We ordered a ton from the menu, and I enjoyed all of them. Corn fritters, tuna tartare, ceviche, lettuce cups, short ribs, green beans, spinach, shaking beef, chicken satay, Indonesian fried rice, naan, potstickers. Some had drinks that night and they looked great. I would definitely recommend!
author: Janelle H.

description:
My first experience here: It's been over a week since I dined here for dinner with my husband and friends but I'm still thinking about it., especially the service end of my experience. Our server James rocks in my book!  Nothing I love more then a server who suggests and sells me on what I need to be eating. James suggested everything we ate and he was dead on, we loved everything!  I'm going to mention dessert first, we went to order just one to share, the Devil's Food Cake but James says you want the warm spicy ginger cookies. I'm like really, I love ginger cookies but didn't feel the table would like but everyone said let's do both. Hands down the Ginger Cookies won, warm, moist, soft ginger flavor. Everyone loved, all 5 or 6 of them. YUM! Devil's Food Cake was too dense and cold for my taste and the salted caramel was off to the side, more as a plate presentation. Though it all got eaten.
Here's what we had, Indonesian Corn Fritter, Butternut Squash Dumplings - light & flavorful, wood Roasted Edamame- nice roasted, Deviled eggs, Roasted baby Beet Salad- light, yummy Meyers Shiso emulsion, and the Roasted Char Siu Black Cod, loved.
Ambience, loud! We were sat next to the end of the kitchen line and next to a party of 8....As we all know there really are no quiet restaurants in SF. 
I'll be back
author: Lori M.

description: Drunken noodles are amazing and really liked the dumplings.  Was a blend between Italian ravioli and Chinese dumplings -- yummy!!!
author: Arvind M.

description: Food was okay, ordered the chicken satay and tasted good.  Ambiance was well done with an element of a relaxing lounge vibe.  Would venture to come here again if I'm in the area.
author: J J.

description: This is the kind of food you might expect from an Asian themed bar in a Westin hotel. Some lazy, deep fried seafood and other dishes, rubbery steak and peppered up meats on a stick. Decent service, beautiful venue (though loud), but well below the standard for Asian cuisine in this neighborhood from places that are half the price.
author: Jared K.

description: Overall a good experience. CS wad solid. Calamari was done perfectly. Moscow mule wad made correctly. Quick lunch stop with a cool environment.
author: Warren S.

description:
Just like the previous posts, the food was small proportions and wayyyyy overly sauced. We started with corn fritters based on recommendations and it wasn't as expected. It was one of their signature dishes and it's safe to say...it's really not that good. FIRST of all..they don't grind up the corn so you're actually LOOKING and eating whole kernals of corn with just fried batter and no seasoning. It was very bland..but the sauce on the side that came with it was wayyyyy too sour (vinagrette and ginger) and it just killed the fritters. Second note, I'm not sure about you guys but I don't actually like looking at whole pieces of corn mashes together like that..reminds me of what's to come out at the other end...corn poop. =p I was expecting the corn fritters to resemble more of crab cakes in appearance.

The Japanese "bop" was small proportioned and it was DUNKED in half a bottle of sauce it seemed. Could not taste anything else except sauce sauce sauce. ANd it was sour, vinagrettey, and just..salty! The pickled vegetables were bland in comparison to the sauce. I found myself reaching for my water and plain rice to compensate for the extreme saltyness.

THe short rib sliders were good, thus giving them 3 stars. It was accompanied by taro chips? really delicious, and the meat was tender. It was served ban mi style with carrots, cilantro. 

Came here for supposed dine about town and made reservations for Sat but it was our fault we didn't check with the restaurant because they dont participate for dinner dine about towns friday and sat nights. The decor and ambiance was really pretty, dim lighted, and renovated

Overall, oversauced small proportion food.
author: Anne J.

description: I went there on a recent trip to SF and will definitely go back next time, just for those crispy corn fritters. They were so good, my friend and I got another order! Butternut squash dumplings were fantastic, and the calamari was nice, as well as the cod. The cocktails were great, especially the pisco sours. I wish I could remember our servers name-truly the best server I've ever had. Friendly, attentive and helpful- I will make sure to sit in her section on my next visit.
author: Michael R.

description: The food was good.  However, the service was extremely slow, which was disappointing.  I'm not sure if they are understaffed or we just received a bad server.
author: Michael J.

description: I was looking for some happy hour drinks and oysters and E&O didn't disappoint. Their moscow mule served in a brass cup and $1 oysters thoroughly satisfied my cravings. Their version of a cocktail sauce is spiced up with sriracha! This is definitely an ideal place to go to if you're just looking to relax and chill in a nice restaurant...and eat a lot of oysters for cheap ;)
author: Chau T.

description: Name Changed... menu about the same... Service the same old "Sucks"
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Dollar oysters, butternut squash dumplings, Russian mule (ginger beer). Great ambiance. Great Happy Hour!
author: Susan G.

description: Great value and comfortable ambiance. We loved the wood fired edamame but they were a bit over salted. The flatiron steak was stellar. And those mai tais - wow do they pack a tasty punch!
author: David T.

description:
When I ate here I was with my new cousin in law and some of my extended family, we sat at a very large table in the center of the restaurant. Before we had been seated they had a very lovely waiting area with couches and a waiter offered us small snacks and wine before dinner. The atmosphere in this place is very elegant but not stuck up or pretentious...very modern and I felt very at ease while dining here. 

This review is from it's previous name the E&O Trading Company(before renovations) but they still had the same amazing food in my opinion. There were 2 particular appetizers that i loved, the Ahi tuna and the Indonesian corn fritters!! So good! And we hadn't even gotten to dinner yet. Before long we were laughing and carrying on amongst the clamour of the restaurant and I never felt more at home. The staff was well versed in all the items on the menu and we never had any issues with getting someone to help us if we needed something. Awesome all around.

For dinner I recommend the pork loin. It's a great take on a classic in my opinion with the grilled bok choy and the fermented black bean sauce. I would definitely go here again. As a matter of fact I am hoping to plan a huge get together here very soon since I work in the city now. 

Stay safe and eat well everyone.

p.s. there are amazing private dining areas for any events you may be planning. Yet again the decor accentuates good taste without being arrogant or pompous.
author: Anthony C.

description: This is definitely not the best Asian Fusion I've ever had, but it is definitely up there. Me and my friends had the lettuce wrap, Indonesian Fried Rice, and the spare ribs. All dishes were very tasty but pretty salty. I felt like I needed a huge glass of water after the meal. I also felt like the food was a tad pricey for what we were getting. I feel like I could go to PF Changs and still get the same quality of food for half the price.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Dined here once and had a great experience.

For a business dinner, the host of our group told the server to "work the menu, and just bring it in waves." Our server (and the food he chose) hit the mark from start to finish. Everything was excellent.

My favorite was the beef tenderloin dish, with the ribs running a very close second. Hoping to return soon!
author: Jayson H.

description: Fantastic bar, excellent food. Try the E&O Old Fashioned! The Indonesian Fried Rice is fantastic. Thanks to the concierge at Hotel Prescott for sending us here!
author: Michael H.

description:
We made a reservation through San Francisco Private Dining Venue (sfpdv.com) for 10 people - quite the challenge in SF. Of the 10, four were kids under the age of 12.

The food was good. Extremely good, even. Even still, I thought the food terribly overpriced. It wasn't a blow-my-socks off meal, and at $50pp (this includes the kids! Under 12!!), I expected a better meal. 

The service, however, was phenomenal. They were always refilling glasses, taking away dirty dishes, clearing the table of empty plates, and asking how things were. This I liked. $50pp like? Meh.
author: binda k.

description: it is a very cute place with great ambience.   All the dishes are meant to be shared (tapas style).  They all tasted pretty good although some of the dishes can be a bit too salty.  The favorite was lamb nann, corn fritters, and buttersquash dumplings.   Dry fried green beans were a bit too salty, and indonesian fried rice was okay.   if you do end coming here, try to sit upstairs!
author: Tiffany H.

description: nice meal on a Sunday evening. squash dumplings a must. asparagus salad is so-so. shaken beef good if u like spicy.  not too busy, quiet enough to talk. good service. overall a solid meal.
author: Roy N.

description: Amazing food and great bar staff. Friendly managers. Prices are high but worth every penny spent.
author: Paton M.

description: Great food, lovely setting. Indonesian rice, butternut squash dumplings and satay platter were wonderful.
author: Dar V.

description: Recently visited E&O kitchen for the first time! Needless to say, I have found one of my new favorite restaurants! their asian fusion style is delicious (dumplings, skewers, etc) and the drinks are absolutely amazing (Sutter Punch). Our server, Victor, was wonderful and made our experience THAT much better. They also have a great happy hour that we found out about- I will definitely be returning with friends after work!
author: Sheryl P.

description: I love their happy hour 3-6pm Monday-Friday - pu pu platter is one of the best deal in town, plus $1 oysters, $5 cocktails, $4 beers...I can eat here every week.  Their dessert is also fantastic way to end a perfect meal...bananamisu, the bananas definitely add a layer of flavor to this moist tiramisu, devil's food cake, basically a decedent chocolate cake, mango panna cotta, so light & refreshing, how can it go wrong?!
author: May L.

description: Food was delicious! Service was good. Service from the bar was slow. The lamb naan was soooo good!! Shaking beef and drunken noodles were delicious also. Highly recommend this place just order drinks way ahead of when you want them.
author: Cherie T.

description: I came to this fine establishment on January 31, 2014. My friend, her co worker and myself came here for happy hour. I must say it was pretty good. We had the Corn Fritters, Dumplings, Ribs, Naan and chicken Satay. All were good and decent pricing. My favorite drink was the Sutter Punch, it had a pineapple, tropical flavor to it. Our waiter was awesome.. I would go to this place if I was shopping in Union Square or just have drinks with friends or maybe an intimate date.
author: Jaiesha C.

description:
Came here for a group dinner on a weeknight.  

THE GOOD:
Very nice ambiance.  
Able to accommodate a large party.  
Staff very courteous and friendly, but once in a while we did have to track down our waitress.
Food is tasty: tarot chips were addictive, tuna tartare fresh, caesar salad light.....
CLEAN bathroom!

THE OK:
Food - the spring rolls and chicken satay could be tastier. The burger was very gamey.....I only ate less than half and I usually stuff my face with a decent burger.

NOTHING BAD!
author: Ima F.

description: Step up from PF Changs but not much.  Everything we ordered was bland except for papaya salad.  Quite disappointing.  The atmosphere is deceiving to make diners think the food upscale.  You might as well go up to blocks to Chinatown and get much better Asian food for a quarter of the price.
author: Bee N.

description: Here for a work dinner on a Wed night and it was a great setting. The service was great and the food was pretty good. We ordered a few dishes to share - Ahi tartar, Pad Thai, and Flank Steak. The restaurant isn't too big and got pretty busy around 7:30 pm. The one downside is that once we paid our tab, we were still having conversation and needed some water refilled, but our server was no where to be seen. Seemed like once we paid, we were of no more use to her.
author: Jackie B.

description: I go here often. The dishes are creative and delish. The ambiance is stellar. Portions tend to be a bit small though.
author: Jacob W.

description: Started the night with happy hour drinks, the atmosphere has a very hip and trendy vibe. The staff is very personal and attentive without being intrusive. We stayed for dinner as the restaurant filled up. The service was spot on, we had enough time to enjoy the food.  The corn fritters were delicious! attended a corporate event earlier in the year and was able to try a range of food. Everything was yummy and fulfilling.
author: Alex L.

description:
The real draw here is the atmosphere and the service. Definitely a cool place for Happy Hour or to get drinks with a date. Had lunch here today while watching the game and the bartender/server was SUPER nice. Friendly, polite but casual - he was great. Seriously 5 stars for that guy. I also noticed that the host was very nice as well. Helped some old lady downstairs to the bathroom, offered her water while she waited, etc, etc. The quality of service here is impeccable. 

For the food...depends on what you get I suppose. Papaya salad was pretty bad (way too dry and no flavor), but the sliders were spot on. Prices are expensive but I would definitely come back to try the rest of their menu.
author: Maria Y.

description: Well I gave it one star because you have to rate it wish it had the option to put -5.  I was there yesterday for dinner with two friends me and  my partner did not like our food it was just MEDIOCRE and when we told our waiter he was very dismissive! I order a stake plate tasted like fish which I'm allergic to and till this moment I'm still sick over it! Stay away from this place!
author: Manny A.

description: We had 6 people in our party. Some of the items we ordered came with less than 6 pieces  so the waiter made sure to accomodate us.  Service was excellent, food was fantastic and  full of flavor.  We ordered: salt & pepper calamari, pork & kimchee potstickers, tamarind & hoisin spareribs, corn fritters (a must!), papaya salad, pad thai, shaking beef and char siu black cod. Dessert we had banamisu, ginger cookies and choc creme de pot special.  E&O will not disappoint!  We'll be back!
author: Jen G.

description: Tried E&O for the first time this weekend with the girls. Def a fan of this place!! Our waiter was amazing and extremely attentive the entire time. I'm gluten-free most days so I really loved that they had a menu for that. I had the shaking beef and it was really yummy! Also any place that has good ahi tuna tartare is good in my book.
author: Stephanie S.

description: So this place sucks; unless, of course, you'd like to pay 19.00 dollars for fatty ground beef in ragu of beef stock and celery served with a side of forgetful noodles, (dan dan noodles.) My wife and I went to this place in search of a romantic outing and instead found ourselves burning $80.00 on three drinks and two less than appetizing entrees. This place is a tourist trap at best and a corporate beigefest at worst. The food looks good on the menu, but the execution? Well let's just say my daughter created better dishes when she was eight. Seriously, the chef here needs to be fired. At one point my wife said, "I'd rather have ramen noodles." And I agree with her wholeheartedly.
author: Will M.

description: It has been a little over 10 years since I last ate at E&O Asian Kitchen, and I must say that it is still every bit as good as I remember it.  My family wanted to have I nice dinner within walking distance to the Curran Theater.  We added notes to the on-line reservation that we had show tickets.  Everything started off without a hitch, and they were very accommodating.  Started with Tuna Tar-tare with sesame rice crackers.  Portions were just right, and the fresh tuna was simply sublime.  My kids loved it.  My main course was the hamburger with a leek bun to which I added cheese and bacon.  They cooked to my preference (medium-rare) to perfection and the spicy fries were the perfect compliment.  A mighty fine burger I must say!  Cocktails were awesome.  I told my wife I'm not going to stay away too long from E&O because I'm coming back for more good times.  Cheers!
author: ron a.

description: DO NOT COME HERE. I bought the $90 deal groupon and it was supposed to be for 2 people. The portion was very little. Any other dishes prices was very high.  I ended up ordered 3 extra dishes that I would not have to order for 2 adults and 1 child. If I knew I had to pay an extra $100 in addition to Groupon, I rather go somewhere else.
author: Kat O.

description: This place was incredible. I ordered about six different things between my mother and I, and every single one of them was one of the best I have ever had. That is all you need to know about this place. I highly recommend it to anyone--irregardless of your taste buds. There is something for everyone here.
author: Mark S.

description:
A fair list of beverages. The appetizers are good - can't go wrong with the mushroom dumplings or the satay skewers.

The entrees are more of a mixed bag. My colleagues give the Malaysian fried rice rave reviews - however with a crustacean allergy it's just easier to order something else than risk a contamination. So the Japanese Bop it was - underwhelming it was. The flavor was fair but I was definitely left wanting. Would I visit again? Maybe - but only because I'm humoring someone getting that fried rice.
author: Albert C.

description: I ate here on 7/27/13.  I ordered the pad Thai and the calamari.  The food was amazing.  The ambiance is beautiful.  The service is good but could use some improvement.  I would go back and visit again.
author: Marilyn A.

description: Nice atmosphere but slow service. Food came out minutes after our order which makes me think it was just sitting back in the kitchen, pre-made in a large vat.
author: Megan M.

description: Excellent service and the food is delicious. My boyfriend and I shared the satay platter, edamame and white rice- it was the perfect amount to share. The edamame is AMAZING! I highly recommend it. Also, the hosts are very friendly and accommodating.
author: Brittan S.

description: The prices should be rated way more than $$. It was expensive for Pad Thai $18 and Fried Rice $17. It did taste different than normal due to the E&O spices but they used way too many onions. My kids didn't eat it. The good thing was there was plenty of shrimp in both dishes, maybe that's why it was so expensive. Another over priced item was the desserts..I asked for 2 scoops of ice cream and it came in a small dip bowl for my kids to spilt. I thought it was a sample scoop to add with the desserts I already ordered b/c it was a this tiny sauce cup. I was charged $7.50! It was just plain Vanilla. Ghirardelli gives out  3 scoops of ice cream that are 10x bigger for $5.50. The ambience was very Asian inspired! The best part was the service! Super nice & accommodating from hostess to the wait staff.
author: Rico B.

description: One of the best modern Asian restaurant I've ever been to! Their menu has a lot of variety, and the food is pretty fancy shmancy. I had the kale salad and kimchi pork dumplings for appetizers and the Japanese "Bop" as a main; was a sunny side up egg topped with nori on top of grilled vegetables (jicama, carrots, etc.) on top of steamed spinach with sesame on top of breaded rose rice (seemingly similar to a hash brown). The ambiance was very upscale and the service was faboo.
author: Tal M.

description: My business partner and I were taking an important contact to lunch, only slightly known to each other. I've never been here before, partner has. The food became the fun topic - each ordering something to share with the others.  We ordered way too much - but left the table with nothing left on any plates.  Fab food.  Great ambiance and a sense of privacy - not too loud.  Looking forward to returning.
author: Becky T.

description: Awesome service and superb ambience!! Fantastic veggie food and desserts. Loved the place. Must go!! Make a reservation and you are in for an memorable time with your companions!! :)
author: Vidhu J.

description: I found this place during  a holiday party. The best "Dirty Martini" in the city. I love this place! The food is great and the service is always good.  It's now on the top of my list for dinner or just to wind down for the day. Everything on the menu that I've tried was excellent. Great ambiance for a relaxing evening.
author: Aura C.

description: The ceviche was amazing especially when served with the taro chips. The calamari was good but too filling from being fried. Last course was pot stickers and the flavor was incredible!  I would highly recommend this restaurant
author: Greg F.

description: Apparently "fusion" is code for bland expensive Asian food - E&O was a total waste of calories and money.  Our $50 meal tonight brought us a whopping two unappetizing appetizers and one drink.  The corn fritters were oily and not tasty at all while the ahi tuna was doused in sesame oil, flavorless, and were colored an unfresh-looking pastel pink.  It is a very nice trendy space and I heard they have a nice happy hour but it definitely wouldn't make up for the food.  All in all we left feeling over-induldged but not satisfied, like a hangover after a night of cheap plastic-bottle vodka.  Highly don't recommend - if you want a decent fancy Asian meal, head over to Ame down the street...
author: Rosers M.

description: Happened upon this exquisite restaurant by accident and could not have been more pleased with the superb food and decor. Especially loved the lamb naan, butternut squash dumplings and the Indonesian corn fritters!
author: Betty S.

description: I can't wait to host our event here. Looking forward to an elegant and educational dinner.
author: Davet M.

description: It is hard to find gluten free menus where you feel like you're still getting the full experience of a restaurant.  E&O's gluten free menu had plenty of variety, and delicious Asian dishes-- it was such a treat!  The service was phenomenal, the renovation beautiful!  If you're craving Asian cuisine, without the worry of soy sauce sneaking in, the gluten free menu at E&O is your ticket!
author: Laura F.

description: Never visited the last one, that said the renovated space looks amazing. Great setup for everything from private parties to dining alone at the bar. The menu has a lot of good looking choices, saking beef was amazing. Great bar service and friendly atmosphere. They also have a great beer tap selection, try the one from Belgium...starts with an H but can't remember the whole name or I would be looking for it because it was fantastic.
author: Grant C.

description: Came for a date.  The upper floor seating is a bit meh, the lighting not too flattering.  I would much prefer the seating downstairs.  Food is decent
author: Athens F.

description: Came here for a light dinner.  The corn fritters are excellent, as is the "bop".  I also tried the mushroom dumplings, which were decent but a bit too rich for my liking.  The check came out to be a surprisingly high amount for the little food we ordered, so if I come back it will likely be during their happy hour.
author: Josh Q.

description: I went here for the first time for happy hour and fell in love with the quality of the food and the ambiance! It's such a classy restaurant with top quality food that is reasonably priced. I highly, highly recommend!
author: Gabe E.

description: Very good food at a great price. Enjoyed corn fritters and the beef satay. Service was very nice and quick.
author: Isaac D.

description: Butternut squash dumplings, cod and coconut cerviche! Service was quick. Atmosphere good! Good cocktails
author: Adam E.

description:
The Club Concierge Alexander at The Ritz-Carlton suggested E and O Asian Kitchen for a girlfriends birthday. Very good recommendation!
A party of 6 for our girlfriends birthday, we decided to do it family style. Passing by on Sutter Street, the restaurant blends in very much to its surroundings. Floor to wall windows shows you inside to a long table where you can see customers eating the Asian Cuisine of E&O Asian Kitchen. Step inside to a dim lit setting, with wooden architecture surroundings. The hostess had a reservation for 3 but she easily was able to accommodate 6 of us. We had the long table in the front window, a perfect spot to people watch. 
For starters, the scallion fried bread with the sauce was amazing. Served warm, it felt more like an Indian dish than an Asian dish, but very good non the less. The corn fritters that are fried, I didn't take much of a liking too. The butternut squash dumplings were one of my favorites. I wish more than a few came on a plate. Amazing. The sauce was good, I thought maybe it needed something more. 
The beef short rib sliders are very savory. Served with a  side of taro chips, it was a very good balance, very refreshing and just enough room. The chicken lettuce cups we ordered as well. Those are the same as other lettuce cups, nothing special, but fresh- like any other Asian cuisine it would be served in. Now, the black pepper shaking beef was the best dish we ordered on the menu. The meat was cooked just right. Matched perfectly with the side of green beans which were also cooked perfectly and a small side of rice, we gushed over how good it was. It must be good if everyone at the table agrees.
The Asian "Gnocchi" rice sticks, natural beef filet, cabbage and spicy soy bean sauce was good. The sticks were filling. The Japanese "Bop" of crispy dashi kokuho rose rice, spinach, pickles, red chili furkake, bonito flakes with an egg sunny side up on top, was the most Asian dish I had tried there. A perfect fusion, it reminded me of Japan. 
To celebrate with the birthday girl who is a light drinker, she chose the Dragon's Kiss. Sparkling wine, aperol bitter, blackberry shrub and lemon, perfect and sweet for a darling who loves alcohol you cannot taste. Bubbly. 
And to end her birthday, the Devils Food Cake with salted caramel was just the right size for her and made again amazing. Now one of my favorite desserts in the city. 
The server was ok, nothing to emotionally engage us. She must have been busy. The hostess was gracious. The bathroom is located downstairs with other private dining rooms. Bathroom is very pretty! The stairs going down to the bathroom to the corner makes the ambiance exactly what it needed. 
Will definitely recommend and come back again to try everything.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
I had some of the best meals of my life at the original E & O, way back when. As it declined in quality and was re-vamped several times, I simply stopped going. But I happened to be passing by today and went in on a whim. 

The interior is lovely and a nice modern take on the space. I was seated at a low table with a high-backed chair that resembled a cage between two other single diners, each in their own cage/chair. I'm pretty tall, so it wasn't the most comfortable way to eat, but I went with it. 

I ordered the chicken bahn mi. I love a good bahn mi, and the flavors in this one were good but far from great. First, it was served on a doughy sourdough roll which, I believe, is a criminal offense. Second, there was no spice or heat. The sauce on the chicken was good, but the veggies and shrub of cilantro were seriously lacking. No one wants a hefty 4 inch stalk of cilantro slapped on their sandwich. Leaves and delicate stems, please. 

Overall the service was good, the decor is nice, but the food I had lacked any specialness and certainly wasn't worth the cost.  

Looks like the glory days of E & O will just have to live in my memory.
author: Bonita H.

description: Was in town for four nights and we came back a second time. Wonderful array of flavors , complimenting, not overpowering. First night I had 12 guests and 4 the second night- only raves from everyone. And ask for James - he was outstanding.
author: Robert N.

description: I visited this restaurant at the suggestion of my nearby hotel. I was worried that I wouldn't get a seat, but I was able to sit at the bar with no problem. The bartender was very helpful and kept me from inadvertently ordering too much.  I ordered the pad thai and it came very quickly. It was hot and fresh, but WAY too spicy. I'm not a baby about spice, but my nose was running like I was a baby. It was just spicy enough to be ABLE to eat, but to not enjoy. Perhaps it was an off night, or maybe I just got the wrong dish. I ate the whole thing because I was starving, but I definitely would not order it again.
author: Stephanie V.

description: Excellent Asian fusion food. The special curry was very good.  The wait staff was incredibly attentive.  Whenever I come to San Fran, I always have a dinner here.
author: Linda N.

description: I love this place...Great food, nice ambiance, friendly staff...Such a good spot. And the corn fritters are a must!
author: Leia V.

description: I've been here for lunch and happy hour.  Lunch was amazing and happy hour was good for drinks but their oysters are disgusting.  Pieces of shell in them and just a bad flavor.  Lunch was awesome and I think it was the Cod that we ordered was what made it so good.
author: Alyse S.

description: I went for a Happy Hour and sat at the bar. The maitre D was really nice and said to go ahead and find seats. I got to the bar and it was not as busy at I thought it would be. The bartender was snobbish and I am not sure if it was just me but I don't see him having conversations with people next to me. Took him awhile to ask if I was doing OK as well as to give the Wifi code. I had to ask another person who works there how to get on the wifi and it was as simple as putting ur full name and email. The selections for Happy Hour appetizers are really small except for the Ribs. Tartar was really small. I don't want to go to this restaurant ever again.
author: Roz M.

description: I came here for a work lunch so it was really nice because we got to use the whole upstairs area. The service that day was great; both friendly and attentive. Sadly the food was just okay and pretty pricey.  The one thing everyone loved was the corn fritters. Everything else including the satay, tofu, salmon, and chicken wasn't very memorable.
author: Alice J.

description: The burger at E&O Kitchen is amazing! Went there for a business lunch. Good ambiance. No wait.
author: Matt J.

description: I love this restaurant as it has super great food and some really nice drinks, but I'm writing regarding Marcela (sp?), one of the employees there. I had called about losing my sunglasses at the restaurant and wanted to know if anyone had seen them. Turns out that Marcela had found them in the next door parking garage which was where I had parked. They are an expensive pair of sunglasses and she could have kept or sold them but she called me back. She also wouldn't take any money from me when I offered. I was so grateful to have them back and so thankful for Marcela's honest nature. Thanks Marcela...you're the best!!
author: Melissa R.

description: THis was one of the worst experiences my husband and I have had since we moved here 40 years ago. Terrible and rude service and bad food which had no taste at all. The manager was no help when we tried to complain and the waitress was rude and not helpful.
author: MaryAnn C.

description: A friend and I met up at this place to check it out.  Here is the run down. Sandy is the bomb server...very cheerful, pleasant and attentive.  Food was good, not great!  Prawn salad and butternut dumplings...WOW!  A definite must have.  Brocclini - was ok...Everyone in the place suggested the cod but we found it very bland.....or nothing to be excited over.  Ahi poke was nothing special, wish they had toast or something instead of those flimsy flat thin things to eat the poke with....and a beef dish - but the beef was ehhhh as well.  We had two drinks.  The kicker was the bill came out to be 140 with tax, no tip...WTF!  Was definitely not impressed with the amount of food and the type of food.  I could have definitely gone some where else....
author: Shel D.

description: E&O underwent a re-modeling not too long ago and the place has great atmosphere for a group OR a date. Dimly lit with lounge music -- but not obnoxious lounge music -- and great food. You should get the lap souchong tea deviled eggs for an appetizer, those are the best. Very unique taste! I'd also recommend the corn fritters. The scallion fry bread is just OK -- a bit bland but refreshing with the yogurt. The shaking beef is delish! The beef is filet mignon grade, I think. Sooo good! If you like eggplant, the roasted eggplant is tasty. I've been to this restaurant four times and I'm sure I'll be back again.
author: K F.

description:
I've been here a couple of time in the past before it was Asian Kitchen and when it was Trading Co. I remember having the corn fritters and it was soo good. I decided to try them again but this time, to do the Dine about Town menu. I was a bit early for my 5:15pm reservation. I got my table and waited for my friend to arrive. Choices of sparkling water and spring water was given... I choose spring or still.. whatever.. my waiter.. Victor was very nice and helpful. Had a small chat with him about the changes to the restaurant and food.  Ordered a pear soda..The pear soda was refreshing and tasty. My friends comes along and we order our appitzers... so it's a family style kinda cusine.. which is great since we both are  very familiar with the concept. We ordered the papaya salad and the vietnamese duck rolls. Both very good. Both have a hint of 5 star or maybe it was tumeric, or anise... wait.. ginger..  it was spicy and tasty.. that pear soda was a good drink to have to help with the heat... the entrees we ordered was the Dan Dan Noodles and the Beef Sirloin Steak. 
The Dan Dan Noodles were soo tasty... but I wish in a restaurant like this.. they dind't just use ramen noodles.. If I wanted instant noodles.. 39cents and Im done.. I don't like it when places do things like that.. it's annoying!  The steak was in my eyes.. too dry and the kim chee was not up to par with what real kim chee tastes like.. When did Kim Chee have onions in it? For dessert we got the Bananamisu and the Mango Panna Cotta. Both deserrts were were amazing.. Loved the service even more. just wish then food was a bit better. I will most likley be back... but probably just the dessert. Oh I almost forgot... the corn fritters were a bust.. not the same as before... no taste.. Sorry E and O.. can you please go back to the orginal corn fritters? Let me know if that ever happens and I'll be back for sure and re-review. :)
author: Bobby T.

description: We were interested in seeing the restaurant after its recent renovation. A good value happy hour menu enticed us in. Food and drinks were good and the new space has a better vibe. But the service was awful. Waitress charged us full price for happy hour items. Jury is still out on this place.
author: Michael E.

description: Food and service are just OK. My waiter was friendly but took a long time to take my order. The green beans are waaayyy too salty. Broccolini is nothing special. The roasted edamame are a bit strange--I think the traditional style is much better. The beet salad was the best thing I had, and while it was good it was not noteworthy. The atmosphere is the best thing going for this restaurant. The recent facelift gave it a beautiful, open feeling. Busy and vibrant clientele.
author: Kelli C.

description:
i hadn't been here since E&O Trading Company became E&O Asian Kitchen but i'm happy to report that it's still just as good! the decor is contemporary and subtle - less of the "I'M AN ASIAN RESTAURANT" theme from before, thank god. looked really busy for a tues. evening when we arrived, but luckily we had a reservation! 

cocktails were delish and interesting

they still have their original, amazing corn fritters! 

tried the butternut squash dumplings in a thai curry sauce and fell in love - just the right combo of sweet and spicy

generous portions of the dan dan noodles and shaking beef - both of which were very flavorful. the beef was so tender!

we were too full for dessert, but will try to remember to leave room next time. i also scoped out the happy hour menu and it looked like a great deal (bar bites for less than $5 and $6 specialty cocktails), so hopefully i can try that soon!
author: Holly M.

description:
the food was ok to good for me..not earth shattering...  but heck.. my wallet broke.. I shelled out $350...no wine at all...this is for my family and my cousin in law's family...2 kids(1 barely ate anything) and 6 equivalent adults.

well I don't live in the city so maybe I'm not too used to the price.. :)

anyways... each dish is not too big but price is a little high for the size... the presentation is very good.. they are well presented. The taste is mostly ok to good .. not too salty or bland.. I prefer low sodium food.. so keep that in mind. 

Overall, it's the price that killed it for me.
author: Harry L.

description: Dinner here yesterday evening was really wonderful.  It had been a couple of years since our last visit.  We had the calamari and ahi tuna tartare for starters which were great.  We then ordered the satay platter and the corn fritters which have always been our favorite item at the restaurant.  The satay was really good, but the fritters fell far short of what they used to be.  Unfortunately they were served with a sauce which was a little heavy for the fritters, and they were not as light and crispy as they used to be.  Our servers were very prompt and thoughtful all evening.  We will back on future trips to San Francisco, but we may not have the fritters.
author: Leonard T.

description: I love the food and would defiantly come back.  Lets keep up the good work!
author: Richard C.

description: Staying at the Marriott Union Square and this is located only two blocks away. Very good Asian fusion dishes. I started with tuna tartare with sesame crisps that was close to what I've had in Honolulu. My entree was black cod on a bed of sauteed greens, which melted in  my mouth...truly divine. For dessert, I had lime cucumber sorbet and ginger cookies, both of which were just scrumptious! I highly recommend E&O
author: Kim S.

description: Came here for the Yelp Holiday kick off party.  I loved the ambiance and set up here with the upper level overlooking the bottom floor.  I was a little bit disappointed in the variety of the appetizer but enjoyed all of them.  The beef sliders reminded me of mini-Vietnamese sandwiches and the delicious fries were served uniquely a bamboo platter.  The drinks all tended to be a bit strong.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Love this place. It's very close to my work and a great place for lunch dates and after hour cocktails. It can be a bit loud and difficult to have an intimate conversation.
author: karin b.

description: We visited this place when it was called Trading Company, and it was okay.  The corn fritters are worth checking out.  The decor is neat.  I think it's a novelty and not the best food.  It also feels over-priced.
author: James L.

description: Solid 5 stars for Madelyn at the front of the house. The Huz and I walked out halfway through the worst play we'd ever seen ("Ghost Bros of Darkland County" by Stephen King and John Mellencamp) and needed someplace to wow us enough to get the bad taste out of our mouths. On our way to the Sutter Garage, we stopped in to E&O for the first time, with little hope of getting a table on  Friday evening during the Holidays. Lucky us, Madelyn was so nice and so welcoming and found us a table right away. Our server Scott R continued that theme through excellent service at dinner. The food was really good (pork/kimchee dumplings, Indonesian rice, and black cod). I did find it a tad too salty, but the Huz disagreed. Definitely a lovely to recover from an evening that had already gone south.
author: Cydney B.

description: Food is still good.  Place looks nice,  stream lined and clean.   I was in love with the Tuna Poke that they served prior to the change....Now they have changed the recipe and it's just not the same.  I miss the old charm that this place had before the overhaul.
author: Aurora R.

description: Went here last night for my birthday and had an amazing experience! Have to give a shout out to the bartender, Tristan, for making such incredible cocktails! I had the gazebo: vodka, basil, lime, and pineapple perfection. The rest of the staff were super attentive. We actually ordered so much found they had to bring us a second table! A little embarrassing, but necessary. We started with the raw oysters with kimchee sauce (so good), then the corn fritters of course (you HAVE to order these), tuna tar tar, naan, and pad thai. Portion sizes are best for 2 people, but my boyfriend and I eat a lot, so maybe 3 normal people. The ambiance was trendy, but not too loud or busy. Really was the perfect spot for my birthday! I noticed they have a private dining room downstairs, maybe a good rehearsal dinner spot for something more upscale. Anyways, we'll be going back for sure!
author: Katie L.

description: Food was OK, but the portions are small and the prices are high, which is the worst combination ever. I would probably not go again.
author: Chitown D.

description: This place is one of the worst restaurants around for Asian fusion. We had a group of 10 and no one would come back. It was over priced and flavors didn't fit. We had the ribs, burger, ahi, fried rice, and duck.
author: Ed T.

description: We went here for dinner and thought the food was fantastic. We started with the corn fritters and they were quite yummy. I had the pork tenderloin and eggplant mash and the hubs had the spicy flatiron. We both enjoyed our food and found it to be filling. The Devils food cake was also good but overpriced, IMO. The service, on the other hand, left a lot to be desired. It took at least 15 min to get our drinks and our server seemed to just be out of it. It's a little funny to be that yelp gave this place $$ rating. We spent just over $100 for our meal which included app, 2 entrees, dessert, 2 beers, and 2 virgin drinks. But perhaps that is just San Fran.
author: Katrina V.

description: Great new remodel! Service top notch! Food excellent and even better with the new Monthly Spice specials. I took a few friends here from NYC recently for dinner a few weeks ago, as well. They loved it! Keep up the great work!
author: Tim H.

description: Had the Steelhead Trout today with cubed sweet potatoes. O'my was that tasty!
author: Scott L.

description: This place has the most delious dumplings and satay's! Cannot get enough! Love to sit at the bar. The bartenders are really friendly, especially Achal who makes the best Moscow mule in the whole city. A must try!
author: A N.

description: I've always loved this place and the recent renovation and menu updates have only made it better. I love to sit at the new smooth and sleek counter top bar while sipping on one of the bartender's (Chris) tasty adult bevvies while engaging in good conversation. The oxtail dumplings in tasty slow cooked soup broth with black beans, shaved carrots and cilantro, the beef, chicken, pork & mushroom satay combo plate and the open faced BBQ pulled pork buns on wheat buns with Kim Chee, cilantro and peppers are favorites of mine. This is great place for bar bites or a sit down meal as the warm and yet, sleek new interior greets you as you walk through the door. E&O Asian Kitchen continues to innovate with their form of non-fancy Asian fusion that borders along the lines of comfort food.
author: Jared C.

description: Found this place by using Yelp app.  What a great restaurant all the way around, food service, and atmosphere. One of the best Pad Kee Mao I have tasted.  Got to try the corn fritters.
author: Cory G.

description:
Tasty vittles!

We were out of towners staying down the street at Hotel Rex and they recommended E&O for dinner. We're generally skeptical of hotel suggestions (regardless of the hotel) but this one was spot on. Had a wide selection of shared plates and all were well-executed and flavorful combinations.

It'll stay on our list of comeback food spots in SFO!
author: Jules D.

description: This place had been redone since the last time I visited (a year ago).  I liked the atmosphere and food, but the service was below par.  The hostess was very slow (waited over 5 minutes before she ever acknowledged I was standing there (and there wasn't anyone in front of me).  The Dan dan noodles were excellent!  The bananmisu was ok, but definitely not worth $9.
author: Christa N.

description:
Always very pleased with this place.

Great small-plates style eating (we never order large entrees here) with a huge variety of exotic pan-asian flavors. 

Highlights include: Indonesian corn fritters, butternut squash dumplings, chicken lettuce cups, green papaya and mango salad.

Great beverages including cucumber ginger beer and a pineapple agua fresca (both non-alcoholic).
author: Lina L.

description: Beautiful restaurant, lovely food, and really attentive service.  The waiter we had was really lovely.  He let me try a couple of red wines when I couldn't decide.  The food was great.  Nice flavours and a fancy, modern, upscale asian eatery.  So pretty.  Great location.  No complaints at all.  A bit pricey I suppose.
author: Kathleen H.

description: What yummy food. Great service. Spectacular atmosphere. And the cocktails aren't too bad either. Try the corn fritters.
author: Desiree H.

description: I am giving this restaurant 3 stars only because the food was OK.
