The appetizers were OK like imperial rolls, chicken lettuce cups and the Ahi tuna tartare....I must say I've tasted better at other places. Although, I was satisfied with the main entrees like the Beef Toppoki and Roasted Black Cod. But I will give 5 stars for the restaurant's décor, food presentation and fast service. Friendly staff and great customer service.
author: Mohamed A.

description: We needed to find a place last minute for dinner. Our concierge told us that this place was "asian fusion" and good. How disappointed we were! We ordered the corn fritters (meh), butternut squash dumplings (excellent) and the ashi tuna poke (meh). We also ordered cocktails. After perusing the cocktail menu and not understanding half of the ingredients, I chose a rum swizzle. How could you go wrong with rum? Well, you can. It was disgusting. Our waiter was no where to be found and we dropped $80 for three small plates and two drinks. I would not recommend going here for dinner, if that's what you want to call it.
author: Heather S.

description:
My second time here after the remodel. They did a beautiful job, it is very modern but comfortable with an open kitchen. Lovely atmosphere.
The food was quite good also. The first time it was very crowded and I think the waitress was a bit distracted. We had to  flag her down several times. They also did not change plates unless we asked .
Second time this was better but then it was quite empty on Sunday night.
Ahi Poke was lovely and nicely sized, mushroom dumplings were very tasty. The prawn salad although tasty had not too many prawns in it ,more fruit.
Wood roasted Black Cod was absolutely excellent each time and cooked to perfection. Tasted the shaking beef before and it was very good.
Mango Panna Cotta was great, light and fluffy.
The wines by the glass seemed to taste a bit old like the bottles had been open for too long or not properly stored. The wine had lost a lot of its original taste.
On the last visit we had a bottle of Christopher Pinot Noir which was very,very good.
Actually a good deal for $ 58.00.
Definitelly will be back
author: Maria C.

description: Had an amazing experience here for dinner with my visiting parents. Their cocktails were inventive but still approachable, and our server Victor was attentive but not overbearing. Not too many veggie dishes on the petite menu, but they packed a lot of great dishes in. Really artful plates that were engaging and beautifully executed.  Loved the corn fritters, really enjoyed the texture in the whole kernels. The salmon entree was to die for - coconut garnish was something I'd never had thought of but that was a great textural and tasty element. I'LL BE BACK !! Happy Hour sounds to die for...
author: Richelle A.

description: Was recommended by coworker.  Eight of us for dinner.  Loved the corn fritters and mushroom dumplings.  Had the lettuce cups and the roasted eggplant side dish. Everything was EXCELLENT!  Had the mango panna cotta for desert - WOW!
author: Tom N.

description: This place was kind of empty on a Saturday night.  Maybe everyone was at the World Series game?  The drinks were good.  The corn fritters were very tasty.  Slightly messy to eat, and a little bit greasier than could possibly be healthy, but definitely a don't miss.  I thought that the veggie dumplings were delicious, but my friends thought that they were kind of bland.  The chicken satay was on the dry side.  The tuna tartare was very good.  Dessert was disappointing.  I am not a fan of bananas in my tiramisu.  Also I don't appreciate ginger cookies as a great dessert item either.
author: Claire J.

description: Well crafted food and fantastic Asian fusion. Recommend the satay platter and pork ribs.  All food was amazing and the open kitchen really gave a great atmosphere.  You can't go wrong here.
author: Brendan M.

description: We went there for an early dinner/small bites.  The ambience is wonderful and the bar is a nice place to enjoy a cocktail and grab a bite. I love the fact that they have a gluten free menu.  The dishes, however, are not up to SF standards.  I had the spicy cellophane noodles.  They were good, but lacked brightness in flavor and the texture was a bit too uniform.  The ahi tuna tartare appetizer was of good quality, but also lacked flavor.  Cocktails were fun and different.  I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a nice place near Union Square but would not recommend it as a destination restaurant.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
E&O is top of the line.  The food, service, and atmosphere are all excellent.

I dropped in for lunch on a Thursday and was quickly greeted by the extremely friendly hostess.  To drink, I had the non-alcoholic cucumber cooler (great recommendation by the bar tender). For lunch I had the Tuna Tartar and Beef Topaki.  Both were very unique and delicious.

I'll definitely be back and hopefully will have the opportunity to try dinner next time.  I highly recommend this restaurant to others.
author: Gregg S.

description: This place is ok but not worth coming to twice.  Came here with a group and it ended up costing 170/per couple -way too much for what you get.  That's with everyone having two drinks and sharing appetizers, few main dishes and desert.  The portions are small, the food for the most part is good but nothing exceptional.  I'd say going for drinks and appetizers is the best option for this place.
author: Frida C.

description: A great spot for a quick lunch at the bar right off of Union Square.  The dim-lit ambiance was very relaxing. I ordered the Beef Toppoki and loved it.  Flavorful with just the right amount of spice.  Went great with a beer.  I will definitely be returning with friends to try something new soon.
author: Jake F.

description: Nice place, pleasant decor, good atmosphere. Food holds it's own, although quite spicy.
author: Roman K.

description: The bartender was very nice. He mixed two drinks for us out of menu.  One is tequila based, very fruity; the other is gin based, tasted very nice. I like the deco there, Asian contemporary. It is on the expensive side. Well, it is located in a very touristy area.
author: Emmy P.

description: We were seated around 5pm on Saturday night & it wasn't busy until around 6:30.  Took our server Gianni 10 minutes to greet us, and another 10 minutes to deliver our drinks. His attitude was poor and seemed like he didn't want to be at work tonight. Too bad, because this is a nice place and their service should be as good as their delicious food. Nice venue, ok prices, bad service.
author: Mel J.

description: Great service and atmosphere. Love coming here for a casual shared small plates dinner. The shitake dumplings are amazing and the short rib sliders very tasty.
author: Jerome S.

description: This place is pretentious and really average, not to mention over priced.  My husband had some dumplings which was a very small portion and intense.  I had a Chinese chicken salad which was pretty boring, one of the most uninspired I ever had.  The dessert was very good however not a reason to go back.
author: Margo L.

description: I haven't written many yelp reviews but did write a fairly harsh one the other day. Then, in contrast when we had dinner at E&O our experience was so different I felt compelled to write - but this time a very positive review. E&O was recommended by the sales clerk at one of the Union Square department stores (although not his first recommendation, which led me to believe he wasn't trying to steer us to his friends.) The place did not disappoint. All of us in our family of four very much enjoyed our dishes. They were served promptly. Our waiter was fantastic. With their extra side rooms this seems like a good place to reserve for an event as well. Thumbs up!
author: Bert E.

description: The cocktails here are great. The food is OK. They have some standout dishes, like the shiitake mushroom dumplings. There are also some busts, like the raw salmon (no flavor whatsoever). I think you can get better Asian food for less elsewhere.
author: Miguel V.

description: We used the Travelzoo deal for this. Ambience was nice, service was very good but the food was just okay. Pretty good deal with the prepaid voucher but I might not do more than appetizers and a cocktail at the bar again.
author: Katrina S.

description: We were here for the opening party last week.  We sampled quite a few items and cocktail, and they were all amazing.  My favorite was the pork belly with pickled mango.  I ate quite a few pork belly dishes at the tasting tent, and the one at E&O was the best.  I also tried one cocktail with tequila and watermelon, it was great.  The whiskey lemonade was tasty as well.  We can't wait to go back to try the full menu.  The decor was really modern, and clean.  I do miss the old E&O though, the pictures, and the fan...  We also tried the dessert, matcha affogato with creme fraiche ice cream, it was a great combination.  And we loved that they garnished it with a green tea Kit-Kat, awesome.
author: Dee L.

description: Visited with some friends who had been there before, good call.  First, neat, clean, well organized, off to a good start.  You have got tot try the corn fritters.  I mean they are CORN fritters, comes with a great sauce.  We got 4 individual dishes then decided to go family style, so we all shared.  Highlight, pork rib sliders, wow, got my attention.  I'm guessing other dishes are just as good.  Definite try.
author: John A.

description: Very disappointed - a client flew in from Austria and we decided to take him to E&O. We had six people at our table. Starting with the service - it took forever to get our drinks - each round we ordered. Food - Mushroom Dumplings, Butternut Squash Dumplings and corn fritters were good - and that was it. We ordered half the menu and all other dishes were soooo disappointing! Green papaya salad - terrible (soggy, tasteless) Shaking beef - chewy, tasted of old rubber, chicken with a side of salad - unpalatable all together - just to name a few. To finish off the evening, something was burning in the kitchen as we sat in smoke for the last 20 minutes of our meal. Never going  back and had to apologize to our client profusely since he is used to  great restaurants and great service from any restaurant we have taken him to in SF.
author: Tatiana C.

description: Had a corporate meeting at this restaurant.  The Chinese foods were fusion which was not bad, but the five stars had to go to CHRIS ... Our attentive server.
author: linda w.

description: My husband and I came across E & O randomly while searching for some great Asian food one night of our honeymoon.  We were overly impressed with the timely service and amazing food!  We first sat down and let them know we were in town for our honeymoon and they immediately brought us two full glasses of champagne on the house.  This really made us feel special.  We ordered many small plates and loved every single dish - the butternut squash ravioli was insane and the BOP was by far one of my favorite dishes we ate while in the city!!  We would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone!!
author: Haley H.

description: Friendly bartenders, great chill ambiance.  Dumplings are great on happy hour...
author: Jose M.

description: Our family and friends have been going to E&O for years.  UNFORTUNATELY, we will NOT be going back after our recent experience.  We sat for 10 minutes without menus and had to physically get out of our seats 5 times to get service for our group during the evening.  We had to ask more than once for everything.  We basically saw our waitress when she took our order and then to bring us our bill.  We never received a couple of the things we ordered.  After speaking to the manager Chris, he tried to rectify the situation with free desserts.  However, we then had to go retrieve dessert menus ourselves after waiting 20 minutes.  We then ordered 5 orders of ice cream/sorbet.  When the complimentary servings came, we received one plate with 3 scoops of chocolate ice cream and four INDIVIDUAL 1 inch by 1 inch scoops of sorbet for the others.  Frankly, it was extremely insulting.  It is such a shame that this place is going to crash and burn with its poor service and management.
author: Traci M.

description: Interesting food.   Reasonable portions.  Outstanding service.  Not expensive and we would return.
author: James C.

description: What a shame! Such a pretty restaurant with a menu that sounded so good. The food was HORRENDOUS! The sliders were bland and cold, the black cod entree was enough of a portion for a four year old and yet underwhelming, the kids had the Dan Dan noodles which were completely tasteless. Never again.  Want a refund.
author: Roy H.

description: I stumbled upon this place with a boyfriend after being turned away by a near by, over booked restaurant.  We had an amazing experience. The decor is beautiful, very exotic.  We loved the food and had great service. There was a bit if a wait but we didn't have reservations and it was a busy night. I'm so glad I found this spot and send friends here all of the time.
author: Brittany H.

description: great place for our company xmas dinner... the key to eating here is a larger group and  pairing the assortment of foods...   with the help of our waitress Rebecca we had a very tasty meal...   warm modern classic decor...  very reasonable corkage fee.  for our table of ten we had a wonderful time  and a great dinner....
author: William W.
